results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
The Open Source Pop-Up dinner is an event that aims to bring the community together for excellent food, great wine, and discussion about the topic of the evening. The topic of this Pop-Up Dinner will be: Art is a Social Instrument.

From celebrity artists like Ai Wei Wei to local, socially-engaged artists who have worked with Open Source like Betty Yu, many view art as a tool for social engagement and political activism--aiming to create change or simply generate communities. However, many artists like Richard Serra reject this distinction, advocating that art should be able to exist without social responsibility. Join artist James Leonard (whose exhibits and talks at Open Source have explored activism and human obligation), musician Mario Scaramuzza (a jazz saxophone player who not only plays music but also repairs instruments), and Mark Andreas (a kinetic sculptor and member of Videokaffe, an art collective whose exhibit is on view at Open Source in March) to discuss how art is a social instrument--or is it? 

What’s for Dinner?
Cream of asparagus tarragon soup
Scallops and ginger sauce
Wild mushroom risotto
Pork loin stuffed with apricots, prunes and cherries with roasted vegetables and port wine jelly
Orange infused creme brûlée 

How much does it cost?
$100 includes a five-course prix fixe meal with wine pairings (and a special course of music pairings with each meal). All proceeds support free and low-cost programs at Open Source. Buy tickets here!

Where is it?
The event will be held in Park Slope, Brooklyn. On the day before the dinner, you will receive the exact location via e-mail.
results.name: Pop-Up Dinner: Art is a Social Instrument (2 tickets left!)

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

results.description:
$20, gather at 7 pm, class from 7:30 to 9 pm


Calling all warriors of love and goddesses of the heart.


Let's awaken our inner fire, women!

Women often fall into the habit of putting others before ourselves – partners, friends, family, children, and while we can move mountains to accomplish things for our loved ones, there can be a vacant hole left where we once held our own Warrior Goddess power. If you feel overwhelmed by your crazy life or judge yourself for falling short of perfection, you've probably learned to be your own worst critic rather than your own best friend. HeatherAsh’s Warrior Goddess Training book shares the antidote to the flawed idea that you are not enough. Direct, honest, and unapologetic, HeatherAsh will show you how to release the layers of expectations to finally see yourself for the authentic, perceptive, perfect woman you really are.

Whether you are new to the Warrior Goddess movement or you have been part of the community for years there will be something juicy for you in this evening gathering. HeatherAsh Amara is the author of the bestselling Warrior Goddess Training and the upcoming Warrior Goddess Way. She is dedicated to inspiring depth, creativity, and joy by sharing the most potent tools from a variety of world traditions. HeatherAsh studied and taught extensively with don Miguel Ruiz, author of The Four Agreements, and continues to teach with the Ruiz family.

Raised in Southeast Asia, HeatherAsh has traveled the world from childhood and is continually inspired by the diversity and beauty of human expression and experience. She brings this openhearted, inclusive worldview to her writings and teachings, which are a rich blend of Toltec wisdom, European shamanism, Buddhism, and Native American ceremony. She is the author of Warrior Goddess Training, The Toltec Path of Transformation and co-author of No Mistakes: How You Can Change Adversity into Abundance.

HeatherAsh Amara lives in Austin, Texas and travels extensively around the world, speaking and teaching workshops.

http://www.heatherashamara.com
results.name: An Evening for Warrior Goddesses: Ignite your Inner Fire! with HeatherAsh Amara

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

It's been ages since we've gotten together (2014 was the last official beer club goes to karaoke event according to my research) for karaoke as a beer group--and after much talking about doing it...we finally are!

As before, we had to guarantee the room and a minimum with a credit card, (THANKS JOEY!) so therefore we have to charge in advance for this. Please check your calendar and make sure you can attend before you sign up.  If you sign up and can't go, you'll get a refund ONLY IF we can get a replacement (otherwise, no refund. Sorry!) We also have to keep a cap on the number of attendees because the room has a limit. Your entry fee gains you access to the room from 7:30 pm-10:30pm so get there early/on time to maximize singing time!

***NOTE: The entrance to the place is actually on 53rd Street right next to the parking garage on the east side of 8th Ave***

***NOTE 2.0: Bring ID, they have a strict policy***

You can bring food into the place but no outside drink. They have a full bar on-site, but as far as beer goes, hope you like Sapporo! :)

Remember, arrive on time (...or don't, and miss out on prime singing time).  I dunno about you, but i'll be ready to go (a great 90's jam by Republica)  as soon as the room is available.  Maybe if the stars align we can extend the room...but we'll see what happens that night (and of course that'll mean ponying up additional money).

Looking forward to seeing y'all for a fun night of karaoke...and some beer.

Join us for this is a very special event, a musical peak experience, performed by the World vocal duet MAPLE SKY.

The MAPLE SKY sound is a romantic, intelligent, and high-minded one. The music inspires a sense of a warm, embracing worldwide community, which takes listeners to a place of dreams and wonder - an overflow to the senses.

Porter Smith and Meirav Eytan are artists from two different corners of the world. Porter composes, accompanies on 7-string guitar, and sings tenor with vocal sensation, Meirav, who is originally from Israel. Porter is an innovative artist, a composer, poet, author, and playwright. Meirav is a rare and soulful singer with a spellbinding voice. Together they court a timeless romance with their voices.

All are welcome. Light refreshments. A program of the Humanist Foundation. Info, call:[masked]-5662. Donations to the Maple Sky duet are welcome.

results.description:
Just because the Ides of March wasn't Julius Caesar's favorite time doesn't mean we can't have some fun!

BRING:


Acoustic guitar (or mandolin, ukelele, banjo, or just your voice), music stand, tuner, capo, extra strings (just in case), and 12-15 copies of lyrics/chords sheets for 2 songs of your choice. 

7:00PM-ish - We try to have the room open for early arrivals.

7:30 - 9:15PM - Our usual group play. Choose songs with simpler chords that will be fairly easy for the group to play (and won't require a lot explanation). Otherwise, your songs - your choice.

9:15 - 9:30PM - Time for anyone who wishes to perform a song for the group. You don't have to be a pro or a great singer. If you are working on a song (original or cover) and want to try it out, here's your chance. Strictly voluntary but it's a great low-key, supportive environment for the experienced and novice to perform.

9:30 - 10:30PM - After we pack up our gear and straighten up the room, those interested can adjourn to Larchmont Tavern a few doors down for some socializing.
results.name: The Ides of March Plus 3

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
This is our Asia Business Network monthly meeting. We meet at a location near Grand Central in Midtown Manhattan for business networking. We are joined by English students from Asia, who are either working or studying as professionals in Banking, Business, Economics, and Finance. They are in America learning English and are interested in business relationships with Asians in America.

There are networking activities and a conversation topic is introduced to the group. There is a short lecture and there is discussion on the conversation topic. The conversation topic is always Asian Banking, Business, Economics, or Finance related!  Asian business current events are introduced to the group, and economic issues that are important to Asians in America are discussed. Social networking time is also given.

There is going to be an Asian language exchange and there is English language instruction offered at this event.

At the end of the meeting the group is invited to go to Karaoke, or an Asian club, bar, or pub. The location is usually in China Town or Korea Town.

The number of English students in the meetup is given to the right of the event organizers name as pluses to the meeting. The students include a large number of graduate students from Columbia and NYU.  Erik is the host of the event. Erik has had years of experience in hosting Asian events in New York. Erik is a established member of the Asian community in the area and he improves networking performance by encouraging social networking and giving coaching for relationship building.

Translation Services: There is a Chinese - English translator in the group, whose services are for members in need of them. There is a Vietnamese translator whose services are offered upon request. The group is planning on adding a Japanese - English and Korean - English translator also. Erik the organizer is also familiar with Indonesian and Mongolian. Indonesian and Mongolian translation services are also going to be offered upon request. Translation services are free.

When the monthly attendance for this event exceeds 30, it is going to be made a weekly event.

There is a $5.00 fee for attending this event.

Thank you,
Erik
The Asian Business Network Organizer
results.name: Asia Business Network's Monthly Social!

results.description:
The second of four in our series of great Black Cinema is Black Orpheus (1959) by French director Marcel Camus.

This retelling of the Greek legend of Orpheus and Eurydice takes place in a Brazilian slum (favela) during Carnival and features an all black Brazilian cast. This is a gorgeous film, full of color and life and with the infectiously sensual music of Samba and Bossa Nova.  American movie goers had neither seen or heard anything like it!  Here's the opening theme https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-KznlNRyjUg

Black Orpheus was Barack Obama's mother's favorite movie and what he wrote about it in Dreams From My Father pretty much sums up its appeal to Americans of the 50s:

"I suddenly realized that the depiction of the childlike blacks I was now seeing on the screen, the reverse image of [Joseph] Conrad's dark savages, was what my mother had carried with her to Hawaii all those years before, a reflection of the simple fantasies that had been forbidden to a white, middle-class girl from Kansas, the promise of another life: warm, sensual, exotic, different"

Black Orpheus won the Palme d'Or at the 1959 Cannes Film Festival, the 1960 Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film, the 1960 Golden Globe Award for Best Foreign Film and the 1961 BAFTA Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

$5 suggested donation at the door

In Portuguese with English sub-titles

Discussion will follow

Light snacks included

results.name: Spring Film Series: Four Classic Black Films

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
* Visit our NYC Dads Group website for more events, news and tales from the dad side! *


It's March. Time for the NCAA Tournament to begin - one of our favorite times of the year.  Time for our monthly dads night out.  Time to make a BIG DEAL for March Madness!

By next Thursday night, your brackets will be completed. Time to put them to the ultimate test to determine if those challenging decisions, data analysis, or unscientific guesses you made were correct.  Let's gather at "Public House NYC", a cool sports bar in midtown Manhattan to watch the NCAA Tourney together with a large crew of other dads.  Friday, March 18 is the first round of the hoops tourney and will deliver 16 games in one day...several of which are evening games.

If you saw their terrific highlight reel campaign during the NFL playoffs with Carson Palmer and Jordy Nelson, you probably know Dove Men+Care have been showcasing their #RealStrength campaign and now they're bringing it to March Madness with "Bonds of Real Strength." 


Dove Men+Care has generously agreed to sponsor "NCAA March Madness Viewing Party" Meetups in several of the City Dads Group locations on the same night.   So dads across the nation have the opportunity to meet up, bond together, watch college hoops, and create a lively discussion/banter on social media.  Special thanks to Dove Men+Care who will be covering the bill for the appetizers and drinks!

We strongly encourage dads to use social media during the NCAA Tournament and especially on the evening of our March Madness viewing parties by using the hashtag, #RealStrength and tagging handles @DoveMenCare @NYCDadsGroup 

* Meeting spot: Public House NYC - conveniently located near Grand Central on 41st & Lex/3rd.  NYC Dads Group will have a private area at the mezzanine bar.

* Based on space limitations, this meetup is only for NYC Dads Group members. No +1's, sorry.

* Appetizers and food/drink will be covered by our sponsor, Dove Men+Care

....and if you haven't already, please complete a bracket and compete in the national City Dads Group Bracket Pool.  Top three bracket scores win a Dove Men+Care gift pack and bragging rights!

To get into the bracket group and make your picks, click this link. Password: cdgbrackets: http://games.espn.go.com/tournament-challenge-bracket/2016/en/group?groupID=658220

Brackets must be completed by Thursday, March 17 by 11amEST. The password for the group is cdgbrackets

Scheduled Games for Friday Night:  TBD

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Again, we want to continue to have more hosted events like this in the future. Please take a moment to thank our sponsor via twitter: @DoveMenCare using #RealStrength hashtag.

Examples: "Thanks @DoveMenCare for sponsoring the @nycdadsgroup #citydads March Madness viewing party for our dads night out! #RealStrength"

OR "A bond of #RealStrength is meeting up with @nycdadsgroup for a much needed Dads Night Out to watch the NCAA Tourney. @DoveMenCare #CityDads"

results.description:
This is The New York Conservatives Meetup Group's 10th Anniversary meetup, Part 2 of 2, hosted by Assistant Organizers, Doug & Natasha.  You may show up for Part 1 hosted by Sheila at 6pm and stay through Part 2, or you may join us starting at 8pm.

The New York Conservatives Meetup Group was founded on March 19, 2006. We began with a half-dozen members ten years ago and have grown to over 380 members since. We hope that many of you can come join us for our 10th Year Meetup Anniversary on Friday, March 18, 2016.

Thank you all for your cooperation in keeping your RSVPs accurate and updated. (No one appreciates coming out to a meetup expecting X number of attendees only to find Y some didn't show.)

ABOUT:The New York Conservatives Meetup Group

WHO: We are a group of like-minded individuals who believe in upholding American conservative values fiscally, culturally, and politically. If you are a Conservative, Libertarian, Constitution Party, Neocon, Tea Party supporter or Republican, we welcome to you join our group and attend our meetings. 

WHAT: We are a political and social discussions group, not an activist group, although activist members are welcome to join our group. 

WHEN: We meet monthly, usually the 3rd Friday of each month, although there are occasional monthly exceptions as posted on this Meetup page. 

WHERE: Our meetup is held at a restaurant in the Theater District, near Times Square in Manhattan. We chose this location for the convenience of mass transportation for all our Tri-State members, predominately those who reside in New York City and New Jersey. 

WHY: Because we are sorely outnumbered by Liberals and Democrats in our Tri-State area. This meetup is intended for us get together to discuss and find common ground with each other.
results.how_to_find_us: Restaurant is located between 6th Avenue and Broadway. Our meetup is on the 2nd Floor.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Close Embrace) w/ Shira and John
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Creative Musicality) w/ Odysseus and Naomi
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/John

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Creative Musicality 
There are dance moves, there are recognizable chord structures, but how do you know what goes where in your dance? Should you be dancing in breakaway with large, powerful moves? Or in close embrace, with small, subtle movement? This series, besides just exploring your creative side of dancing, is to get you to start training your ears to truly listen to the music and all of its components. Join us for an entire month exploring different types of blues music and how to use the music to inform your musical choices. 

This Week: Soul and Gospel
The powerful uplifting music of soul and gospel helped many Americans get through some of the toughest times in American history such as slavery, indentured servitude, the Great Depression, segregation, civil rights, and the numerous women rights movements.  Join us to explore how to reflect these huge contrasts in your own dancing. 

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 100 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
http://www.sheephillastro.org/home.html

http://www.sheephillastro.org/home.html

Few folks are privy to the fact that there is an astrological observatory tucked away in the residential folds of Morris County, NJ.

The Sheep Hill Astrological Association is a non-profit that promotes hobbyist astrological observation and education while maintaining its own little observatory in Boonton, NJ.  You can join the association for a nominal annual fee if you desire.  Then you can learn how to use the telescope through a few hours of training, and then you are free to pick up the key and go there on your own, to observe the heavens, whenever you wish.

Every third Friday, the association hosts an open house, free of charge, so that the curious public can come and take turns viewing through the telescope. The meeting is led and hosted by experienced members, who will also point out interesting astrological phenomenon that is is occurring at that particular time.

Dress WARMLY, as the domed roof hatch opens up to the outside to allow viewing.  You should also bring a small flashlight, as the lights around the observatory will be turned off so to allow no light interference for optimal viewing.  A faint red light will help you up the stairs to the top level of the observatory, when you enter, so that you can view through the telescope.

The event is FREE.  If you would like, please consider offering a donation to the association, as they are currently fund-raising to repair the roof of the observatory, which is in dire need of repair in order to keep it open and functioning.

NOTE:  If the sky is too overcast, raining, or snowing, assume the event is cancelled.  Updates should be posted on the association's website here: http://www.sheephillastro.org/home.html

The event starts at 8:30 pm and goes no later than 11 pm.

PS:  Any of us can get together thereafter, and hang out at a diner or fetch a drink, etc.  Let's play it by ear and see how it goes.  :-)
results.how_to_find_us: Drive all the way up the hill to the end of Ross Drive.  Walk in to the little observatory.

results.description:
MULTIGROUP EVENT! WE'LL BE JOINED BY 2 OTHER GROUPS.

Join us at "The Balcony Lounge" In Carlstadt NJ for there Latin Elite Night With Some Top 40/Classic Music Mixed In.

The Balcony Caters To A Sophisticated & Mature Crowd! The Music Tends To Start Up At About 10pm Or So.

If you haven't been to the Balcony yet, you will no doubt love the ambiance and decor of the place. Beautiful chandeliers overlook the main room. The food here is good and there are 2 bars available for ordering drinks.


Meet & Greet At 8:30pm.

There Is No Cover Charge Before 9pm. So Come Early If You Want To Save A Little Money.

At 9pm, The Balcony Charges A Cover Of $10. This Does Include Access To A Light Buffet At Midnight.

Free Dance Lesson Provided By The Venue At 9pm.

DJ Frankie Vazquez Starts At About 10pm With A Latin/Top 40 Mix.


We'll have a few tables or section in the main balcony room. When you walk in, you'll pass the first bar & enter to the left to go into the main room.

Free Street Parking Available On Side Streets. (PLEASE READ SIGNS TO AVOID GETTING A TICKET IN A NO PARK ZONE) Or You Can Do Valet For An Additional Expense.


Looking forward to a fun night of socializing & dancing!

This Place Is Located In A Residential Area Of Carlstadt NJ. Close To The Meadowlands Area By Giants Stadium. 

www.thebalconylounge.com

Come join me in bringing Spring in with Laughter at the Comedy Show. Seating begins at 9:00pm - Comedy Show starts at 9:30pm.$20 Admission fee includes 1 free Drink (beer, wine or soft drink)
Appetizer and drink specials all night long -

****Before the Comedy Show, Dinner reservations available for those who are interested before the show **** After the Comedy Show, enjoy their Frank Sinatra and the "Rat Pack" Tribute Music - 11:00 PM to close - Martini and "Old Blue Eyes" Cocktail Specials to put you in a cool mood!

For more information on the comedy night, call:[masked]

------------------------------------------------------------------


HEADLINER--JOE FERNANDES--


A Cubish (half-Cuban, half-Irish) comedian who grew up in Texas, Joe had an affinity for the sport of baseball and dreamed of playing for the Houston Astros. When his body didn't grow up with his dreams he decided to start performing comedy.

Joe has been performing standup consistently for 5 and a half years now and was a finalist for the Andy Kaufman Awards as well as a member of the Chicago Just For Laughs Festival in 2011. He also has performed in the World Series of Comedy in Las Vegas, the Boston Comedy Festival, the Laughing Stock Comedy Festival, and the Laughing Devil Festival.

Armed with smart and satirical jokes as well as bits that involve character work and audience participation, he always finds a way to make the crowd have fun. He is a regular on the Chicago comedy scene, having done shows at virtually every club in the city. Joe has opened for Natasha Leggero, Jon Lovitz, Nick Griffin and Harland Williams ------------------------------------------------------------------


Update on Comedy night!!!!! I've just reserved tables --- You just have to call and make reservations under Cassie and Miriam and you pay on the night of the show.

Miriam

Dinner Update: I made dinner reservations for 7:30pm. I made it for 8 dinner guests, but can be changed if more members are interested. It'll give us plenty of time to eat and socialize. Seating for the comedy begins at 9:00pm and show starts at 9:30pm-So if anyone who hasn't responded for dinner wants to join us, let me know so I can change the guests amount. Thanks!

We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Dueling Pianos originated in the fabled bars of New Orleans in the 1930s, and spread West across the nation. This exciting, high-energy, all-request entertainment experience has even taken over the Las Vegas strip – and now, Dueling Pianos has found a home in New York City. Imagine the top piano players on the East Coast playing a non-stop, rock-and-roll party where you pick the playlist!

From Billy Joel to Bon Jovi to Britney Spears to Biz Markie, no tune is off-limits. Equal parts concert, comedy and cabaret, you’ll laugh along, dance along and sing along!  Join a group of NYSN members and friends as we spend the night socializing while enjoying the show!

How it works:  You can meet the group there or join us for a group dinner before the show (posted separately).  We will have a special section set aside to sit band enjoy the show. There is a 2 drink minimum  and they will put you on separate checks.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own. You can also invite friends.  NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be your host.

Cost: $20.00 PRE-PAY ONLY EVENT (NO TICKETS SOLD AT THE DOOR) PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/dueling-pianos-musical-sing-a-long-and-comedy-cabaret-tickets-22613227773


How long does it last?  about 90 minutes.

Dress code?  most come from work so business casual.
results.name: Dueling Pianos Musical Sing A Long and Comedy Cabaret

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

This is going to be a very special night, with our first ever all girl DJ battle, where the ladies will be battling for your attention! (And yes of course, guys are more than welcome to party it up, while these ladies rock the beats.) Remember that your headphones will glow to the color of the DJ booth that you are tuning into, meaning that you will be able to visually vote on site, to show them who it is that’s stealing the night! All DJ’s will be spinning a mix of genres, so we are expecting this on to get wild.

DJ 1 (Green) VS. DJ 2 (Red) VS. DJ 3 (Blue)

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: All Girl DJ Battle!

results.description:
UPDATE 3/18/16

Photo Minions!! Currently there are 90 RSVPs for tomorrow's sunrise meetup at Central Park.  
This event will begin at 6:00AM!!

If you are on the RSVP list and won't be able to attend, please be courteous and change your RSVP from yes to no. 

Forecast for tomorrow morning is clear skies with temperatures in the mid 30s and light wind.  
Please review all the details on the event page and I'll see you all bright and early tomorrow morning.

NYC Photographers will be 6 years old!!  What better way to celebrate than to go back to the place where it all started -- Central Park!!

This year's plan:

Weather permitting, we will meet in front of the 5th Avenue Apple Store.  Nearest subway station is 5th Avenue (N, Q, R).  From there we will enter the park to get lost while take some long exposures and capture some colors as the sun rises around 7am.


* There is no planned route, so make sure you are on time.  We will not answer calls or messages once the photowalk begins.

* Dress appropriately for the weather!

* Bring your DSLR camera, or camera with a mode dial to shoot in manual mode. Review your camera's manual to review the settings. Charge your batteries and bring your empty memory cards.  If you have never shot in manual mode before, Boris and I will do our best to help.

* Tripods are recommended for long exposures.  Remote is optional.

* Pack snacks and a drink.

* Bathrooms are available at the Apple Store, which is open 24/7.  Use them if you need to before we go into the park, otherwise you're gonna have to hold it.

* Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are.


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927)

********************

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at https://www.paypal.me/nycphotographers.  (You will see my name.) This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in front of the Apple Store.
results.name: NYC Photographers 6th Anniversary Photowalk: Sunrise in Central Park

results.description:
NOTE:  THIS TRIP IS SCHEDULED FOR SATURDAY OR SUNDAY DEPENDING ON LOCAL WEATHER CONDITIONS. WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO ANNOUNCE ON THURSDAY, MARCH 17th WHICH DAY WE WILL ACTUALLY BE GOING TO THE WORLD TRADE CENTER ON.

IF YOU SIGN UP TO GO ON SATURDAY AND WE WIND UP GOING ON SUNDAY AND YOU CAN'T GO ON SUNDAY, WE'LL REFUND YOU'RE PAYMENT ON REQUEST.

______________________________________________________________________
We have a wonderful day planned for you!!

Image taken by GarySchlagel

The Brooklyn Bridge shot from the Manhattan Bridge

or

The Manhattan Bridge shot from lower Manhattan.

(Lighting conditions will dictate which location we shoot from.)

Corner of Transit Hub with Freedom Tower as the background

Image taken by Gary Schlagel

Expansive View of Transit Hub

Partial View of Ceiling

Inside looking out at NYC Sky Line

Stylized view of a portion of the Transit Hub's Ceiling

While the World Trade Center Transportation Hub isn't quite finished, it's close enough to allow incredibly good photo ops.

Once the Hub officially opens to the public, crowds will make photo ops impossible. Don't miss this chance to photograph this icon while it's still possible. You may not get this good of a chance again.

TRIPOD Regulations:

Officially, you can't use tripods inside the World Trade Center and/or the Transit Hub. In addition, you can't use tripods outside or on the grounds of the World Trade Center or Memorial. However, we may be able to get away with using tripods while on the neighboring city streets. 

Here's what you day will be like:

We'll meet at 1 or 2 centrally located sites in New Jersey at around 5:30 a.m. and car pool into New York City. Passengers should contribute $20.00 per person to the driver to cover gas, tolls and parking lot fees. (Street parking isn't readily available and drivers will have to park their cars in commercial parking lots. Local parking fees are fairly reasonable on a Sunday.)

Anyone wishing to meet us at our our shooting locations will be given our meetup locations a day or two before the event. 

Our first stop will be either at the Manhattan Bridge in DUMBO where we'll walk up onto the bridge for an elevated view of the Brooklyn Bridge. (See image above.)

or

We'll gather along the East River in lower Manhattan to shoot the Brooklyn and/or Manhattan Bridges from the NYC side.

Weather and light conditions will determine which site we photograph and that decision won't be made until the morning of the photo shoot.

After our bridge shoot we'll drive over to the World Trade Center, park our cars and proceed on foot. We'll spend the next several hours photographing the inside and outside of the World Trade Center and the Transportation Hub.

After our photo shoot, we'll drive over to Houston Street and have lunch at Katz's Deli (where Harry met Sally).

After lunch, we'll head back to our rendezvous points.

Stylized view of the Freedom Tower
results.name: World Trade Center Transit Hub and NYC Bridges

results.description:
NOTE:  THIS TRIP IS SCHEDULED FOR SATURDAY OR SUNDAY DEPENDING ON LOCAL WEATHER CONDITIONS. WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO ANNOUNCE ON THURSDAY, MARCH 17th WHICH DAY WE WILL ACTUALLY BE GOING TO THE WORLD TRADE CENTER ON.

IF YOU SIGN UP TO GO ON SATURDAY AND WE WIND UP GOING ON SUNDAY AND YOU CAN'T GO ON SUNDAY, WE'LL REFUND YOU'RE PAYMENT ON REQUEST.

_____________________________________________________________________

We have a wonderful day planned for you!!


Image taken by Gary Schlagel


The Brooklyn Bridge shot from the Manhattan Bridge

or

The Manhattan Bridge shot from lower Manhattan.

(Lighting conditions will dictate which location we shoot from.)

Corner of Transit Hub with Freedom Tower as the background

Image taken by Gary Schlagel


Expansive View of Transit Hub

Partial View of Ceiling


Inside looking out at NYC Sky Line


Stylized view of a portion of the Transit Hub's Ceiling

While the World Trade Center Transportation Hub isn't quite finished, it's close enough to allow incredibly good photo ops.

Once the Hub officially opens to the public, crowds will make photo ops impossible. Don't miss this chance to photograph this icon while it's still possible. You may not get this good of a chance again.

TRIPOD Regulations:

Officially, you can't use tripods inside the World Trade Center and/or the Transit Hub. In addition, you can't use tripods outside or on the grounds of the World Trade Center or Memorial. However, we may be able to get away with using tripods while on the neighboring city streets. 

Here's what you day will be like:

We'll meet at 1 or 2 centrally located sites in New Jersey at around 5:30 a.m. and car pool into New York City. Passengers should contribute $20.00 per person to the driver to cover gas, tolls and parking lot fees. (Street parking isn't readily available and drivers will have to park their cars in commercial parking lots. Local parking fees are fairly reasonable on a Sunday.)

Anyone wishing to meet us at our our shooting locations will be given our meetup locations a day or two before the event. 

Our first stop will be either at the Manhattan Bridge in DUMBO where we'll walk up onto the bridge for an elevated view of the Brooklyn Bridge. (See image above.)

or

We'll gather along the East River in lower Manhattan to shoot the Brooklyn and/or Manhattan Bridges from the NYC side.

Weather and light conditions will determine which site we photograph and that decision won't be made until the morning of the photo shoot.

After our bridge shoot we'll drive over to the World Trade Center, park our cars and proceed on foot. We'll spend the next several hours photographing the inside and outside of the World Trade Center and the Transportation Hub.

After our photo shoot, we'll drive over to Houston Street and have lunch at Katz's Deli (where Harry met Sally).

After lunch, we'll head back to our rendezvous points.


Stylized view of the Freedom Tower

results.description:
Hi Members. It's been awhile since our last meetup. I wont bore you with excuses or details, just understand I am planning 2 physical Meetups for April 2016. One will be Instructional, and one will be fantasy evening wear (with a vintage twist)!

In the mean time let's have a "Virtual Meetup!"

I've been attending other drawing groups and checking out other fashion events in the city (like the Fairy Tale exhibit@ FIT & an African Fashion Week lecture). There are a lot of new members, so I thought we could post some of our artwork that's been created since our last meetup. It can be from anywhere; fashion or not; hopefully with a blurb either about the work or about the artist.

It's a great way to introduce ourselves to new members, and share our work with everyone. This will be a kind of "Introduction" until I confirm the dates for our next "real" meetup.

Welcome to all new members, and Welcome back to the regulars.

p.s. - I've chosen a date, (just so it'll be posted), but we can start posting images immediately!

Warren K. Bradley


Keep an eye out for the "Real" Fashion Drawing Meetup : April 2016

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

"Join over a thousand community gardeners and greening professionals from all over New York City for a day of learning, sharing, networking, and greening inspiration at the 32nd Annual GreenThumb GrowTogether!

This year's conference features exciting new workshops and returning favorites, including many hands-on and youth-focused workshops, for gardeners of all ages.

How to Register:

Please pre-register online by March 14, 2016. Pre-registration tickets cost $5 and includes breakfast, workshops, lunch, and a t-shirt. Please pre-register for tickets here.

Tickets at the door cost $7 and will include breakfast and workshops.

Children 12 and under are free.

Please note: If you do not pre-register, you are not guaranteed lunch or a t-shirt."

results.description:
You've asked us for it and now it’s finally here, New Jersey's 2nd Annual Distressed Mortgage Expo is scheduled to take place on Saturday March 19th, 2016. 

While some investors complain about the shortage of real estate deals, savvy investors and hedge funds have been purchasing billions of dollars of delinquent loans at a fraction of the cost.   Come learn how top mortgage note investors and hedge fund managers are crushing it in today's market - whether it be flipping portfolios of notes, collecting obscene amounts of cash flow, or acquiring heavily discounted properties.  

Gone are the days where investors needed millions of dollars, years of knowledge, and connections to make substantial returns in notes. Both deep-pocketed institutional investors and brand new investors with little or no capital are thriving in this asset class. But don’t just take our word for it. Come network directly with a community of active portfolio managers, note buyers and sellers, note brokers, and highly rated industry vendors.  

What is more exciting is the opportunity to meet and learn all of the above topics from the best of the best investors in the Tri-State area.  Think about it.  How much easier will it be for you to apply strategies taught to you by the same people actively doing it in your very own backyard?   The speakers are not here to sell you additional programs. They are here to share what they know and spread the wealth.    

Some of the panelist include:        
- Donna Bauer - The Original Note Buyer 
- Alex Goldovsky - ProTitle 
- Mike Ruscica - CEO of NoteConference 
- Mahir Allan - MJS Financial Corp. 
- Kevin Cordell - Madison Management 
- Cathie Jeffs & Cathy Cray - Paper Assets Capital 
- Belinda Savage - IRA Services 
- Jamie Raskulinecz - Next Generation Trust 
- Brian Meara - Bormio Real Estate Solutions 
- Fuquan Bilal - National Note Group 
& many more speakers to come    

*** If you are interested in speaking at our event please reach out to us. ***     

Now if you thought all of the above was already huge, we have more.  Along with the above we also have 2 breakout rooms dedicated to serving the intermediate and advance investors in the game.   

So whether you are new to the business of creative financing/note investing or an old pro looking to take your business to the next level, this is an event you simply can’t afford to miss.  So sign up for the event now because tickets will sell out fast!     

PRIVATE NETWORKING:     
With 200 people at the event, Note buyers meet all the note sellers you could ever potentially need to meet.   Along with the above, there will also be a ton of vendors, buyers, sellers, hard & private money lenders at the event as well.  What else could you ever ask for?     

EVENT SCHEDULE: 
Schedule is subject to change till day before the event.   

*** Click here to view the event schedule ***  

ADMISSION:    
This event is limited to 200 people. If you are serious about attending please pay for your ticket now.  Admission includes LUNCH! RSVP'ing for this event alone without payment does not guarantee you a seat.  

- $39 - Special till March 1st 
- $69 - Till March 19th 
- $89 - General Admission ( No exceptions )  

************************************ 

Click Here to Submit Payment Via EVENTBRITE! 

************************************ 

EVENT VENDORS:    
For those who want extra exposure, you can do so by becoming a vendor for our event.  Benefits of becoming a vendor are: your company name, link to your website and a short company description will be include in the event page and on all our emails for the above event.  More importantly, you will also have a vendor table to display your product or services at the event.     

*** Become an Event Sponsor today! ***

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Balsam Lake, Graham, Doubletop 

*** This should only be attempted by experienced bushwhackers *** 


10.5 miles, 3500 feet rise, 6-7 hours - Map 142
Car spotting - BE EARLY!
Winter conditions will exist - be prepared! Snow shoes and microspikes!

Leave no Trace

This hike is not for kittens

I cannot carry you if you can't hike out of the woods


Prepare to be up to your neck in snow (not marshmallows)


The DEC limits group size in this area to 20.


---

WARNING REGARDING BUSHWHACKS: "Bushwhacks" are hikes that go off of maintained trails and through pure wilderness.  Please make sure you are very confident in your ability to navigate through the woods without trails since it is very easy to get lost in these forests, especially in the summer.  Map & Compass REQUIRED. GPS is also recommended, but it is not a substitute for a map & compass and the skills to use them effectively.

---

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
CodeAcross is a national weekend of simultaneous events in the Code for America network of more than 40,000 volunteers and more than 130+ brigades throughout the US. 

As part of this event, Code for JC will host its annual CodeAcross Hackathon on Saturday, March 19 at the Hudson County Boys & Girls Club. The goal of our CodeAcross event is to activate the local civic technology network and collaborate with neighbors to develop innovative solutions that help identify and solve real city challenges. 


Open to all students and professionals, CodeAcross gives everyone the opportunity to grow and learn – no matter their background or skill. Urbanists, civic hackers, government staff, developers, designers, students, community organizers and civic advocates all participate. CodeAcross isn’t just a chance to build websites, visualizations, and other hacks; it’s also an opportunity to build relationships within the community. Jersey City’s CodeAcross collaborative environment allows teams of all kinds to push the boundaries of innovation and take creative risks for a chance to make a significant impact.

Theme: Public Safety (Health & Security)

With the support of the relevant departments within the City of Jersey City, we will have access to Open Data for participants to use for their projects and presentations. Representatives from the city will also be present during the day to work with the teams, share insights, and also experience first hand the collaborative power of the community working in their areas of focus.


Some of the civic problems we plan to solve are:

• What intersections have the highest propensity for traffic accidents, and at what days of the week and times of day?

• What impact does weather have on overall police activity?

• Where should we stage police resources to create the shortest response times and distances?

• Is there a relationship between drug sale/use and/or violent crimes and vacant properties?

http://codeforjc.org/CodeAcross2016/

WHEN: March 19, 2016

WHO: Hosted by Code for JC. Attended by anyone with the passion to make Jersey City better. We welcome urbanists, civic hackers, government staff, developers, designers, students, community organizers and civic advocates to all participate.

WHERE: Boys & Girls Club of Hudson County. People will connect with other CodeAcross events via #codeacross on Twitter and Tumblr.

WHY: Goal is to inspire residents everywhere to get actively involved in their community.

Desired Event Outcomes: 

• Identify community concerns, examine issues, and prototype solutions that help our communities and make the government more transparent and more safe using public safety and health data 

• Continue to power the narrative of Jersey City, the ‘Silicon Backyard’ being the leading modern city in New Jersey. 

• Build lasting partnerships between the civic hacker community and the Jersey City Government, City Council Members, Council Staff, Nonprofit, Corporate and Educational Institutions 

Agenda: 

This hackathon will begin with an overview of the event and event’s theme, followed by inviting the participants to suggest ideas and congregate into teams based on their individual interests and skills. The main work begins and lasts a number of hours. This all culminates with each team demonstrating their project or prototype, as well as presenting on their collaborative process (and usually having to incorporate some fun non-traditional component like summarizing what they did in the form of a haiku). Hackathons are fun, a great way to meet others with similar interests and skills that may not have the opportunity to interact otherwise, and a great way to showcase the amazing technology and civic minded talent that exists right here in our community.

8:00 AM Event organizers arrive to help set up

8:30 AM Food/Coffee/Water arrives

9:00 AM Breakfast 

9:30 AM Welcome and Introductions

10:00 AM Open Data Discussion

10:30 AM & 11:00 AM Break out to form teams and hack!

12:00 PM Lunch

4:00 PM Presentations

5:00 PM Judging

Please tweet:

#CodeAcross #CivicTech #CivicHacking #SiliconBackyard #MakeItYours #JerseyCity
results.how_to_find_us: http://codeforjc.org/CodeAcross2016/
results.name: CodeAcross Hackathon (Public Safety & Health Data Theme)

results.description:
SO MANY OF US HAVE HIKED OUT TO GERTRUDE'S NOSE BUT WHO HAS EVER BEEN DARING OR ADVENTUROUS ENOUGH TO EXPLORE WHAT LAYS BENEATH IN "GERTRUDE'S NASAL PASSAGEWAYS"?

Please Note: Even though the actual hiking portion of this adventure is not that difficult the crevice exploration will be more challenging requiring athleticism, good balance and the ability to be in control of your body. This hike is recommended for those that enjoy ROCK SCRAMBLING. Once we reach Gertrude's Nose there will be a focus on the exploration of the crevices beneath.  Anyone interested in this hike that does not want to participate in the crevice exploration must be prepared to self lead themselves back from Gertrude's Nose and must also leave a 5-star rating since they have been fore-warned! You can't complain if you fail to read the description.  Whew! - Glad that's out of the way...now on to the description:

Arguably the most picturesque vista in the Shawangunks, Gertrude’s Nose is a geologic snapshot of the destructive natural forces that are slowly ripping apart the Shawangunk conglomerate and leaving behind some of its most intriguing features. The cliff’s name stems from a 1682 deed giving land to Gertrude Bruyn, a settler of Dutch descent.

Our hike will traverse miles of stunning views and fascinating geological formations including Gertrude’s Nose, a great wedge-like mass of conglomerate cliff. Gertrude’s Nose looks like the prow of a great ship, with massive blocks of fallen rock below.  From the peak, you have stunning views of The Catskill Mountains to the north and the Hudson Valley to the east.

But the fun does not stop there!  Rather then walking right over the surface of this natural beauty we will get down and dirty doing whatever it takes to reach the bottom and fully explore the numerous crevices interlaced throughout Gertrude's Nose. (That's right folks - I'm bringing the webbing!)

Finally we will complete our hike through dense hemlock forest and over streams as we marvel at the crags and crevasses of the Shawangunk Ridge.

WHERE TO MEET?

WE WILL START AT THE UPPER PARKING AREA ADJACENT TO LAKE MINNEWASKA ALL THE WAY UP THE HILL AFTER PASSING THROUGH THE MAIN ENTRANCE GATE.

Distance:  approx 8 miles

Hiking Pace:  Up to 2.0 mph - In the Crevices it will be Slow but physically challenging

Estimated Hike Time:  7 hours

Difficulty:  Advanced Beginner/Intermediate - Rocky Terrain and Crevices with possible exposures - I will bring a 50 ft. handline to help navigate any hard terrain.

Current Weather Forecast: Partly Sunny with a high of 48 Degrees 

Fee: $10. per car

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Raincoat/Windbreaker

• Hiking Poles (if desired)

• "Scrambling" Gloves - Lightweight with good grip - Gardening gloves from Home Depot work great!

• Shoes with good grip - preferably with ankle support

• Headlamp with spare batteries - Home Depot has a great 100 lumen headlamp for only $12.99!

• A Small Pack - nothing too large that will become a hindrance in the scrambles

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set

Afterwards feel free to join us for some food and drink at a venue to be decided in the New Paltz area.


**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**


NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

venue.name: Stanley Isaacs Senior Center

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) and is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, March 19th, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly. A light breakfast of juice, coffee, pastry and/or bagels will be offered.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly. 

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. The building is offset from the street (toward the FDR Drive), enter through sliding glass doors. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Avenue (uptown) or 2nd Avenue (downtown).

Thanks and see you there!

results.description:
DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER

Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!). 

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St. with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

See you Downtown! 

Terms and Conditions of the participating in our group:

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY. 
BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. 

JOINING AND SIGNING UP FOR DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 

I certify that I am 18 years of age or older and that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore I, individually, hereby release and discharge, DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizers and Co-organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER programs or activities. 

DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizer and its Co-Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

The Downtown Pickup Soccer Team

results.name: Morning Soccer @ Columbus Park - 9:45AM

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
