results.description:
Let's check out the St. Paddy's Day Parade in YONKERS on Saturday March 19th -- the parade starts at 1pm so let's meet at the Ned Devine's Saloon around noon so we can get a good spot. We will go to another bar after the parade for some Irish food and beer...

We've not gone to this parade in quite a while - here's the Q&A about what, where, how, and PARKING. 

Where is the Parade?


The Parade starts at Hyatt and McLean Avenues and ends at McLean Avenue and McCollum Place by Coyne Park.  

Where can I park the day of the parade?
There will be free parking at Empire City Casino.  Use the YONKERS AVENUE ENTRANCE of the Empire City Casino for FREE Shuttles to the parade route.
Shuttles will start running at 9:30 AM and drop off and pick up spectators on the corner of Hillview & Kimball Avenues, one block up from McLean Avenue until 5 PM.  In addition there is street parking on Bronx Blvd and Bullard Avenue on the east side of the Bronx River Parkway. Please do not park on the local side streets, be courteous to our neighborhood, Vehicles will be towed at your expense if parked illegally or in resident driveways. McLean Avenue will be shut down the length of the parade route from 11:00am till 5:00pm and the will be no parking or driving permitted.

Where can I view the parade?
All of McLean Avenue will offer excellent viewing points for the parade. In addition, a stage for dignitaries and announcers will be located at McLean Avenue & McCollum Place. News12 will be set up at the corner of Harding and McLean Avenues in front of 855 McLean Avenue.

What time and what streets be closers?
McLean Avenue from Woodlawn Avenue to Bronx River Road will close at approximately 11 a.m. The rest of McLean Avenue being used by the parade will be closed at 12:30 p.m. All streets that are being used for staging will be closed until the Marching Groups have passed. McLean will reopened as soon as it is safe after the Completion of the parade.

What bus routes are being moved/changed/cancelled?
Bee Line Bus Route 25 will be rerouted to accommodate the parade.

Are there Porta Potty Toilets?

There will be 14 porta pottys available throughout the parade route. On the following side streets.
a) 2 behind River's Edge, 1064 McLean, one block up from Bronx River Road
b) 2 on Woodlawn Avenue next to 998 McLean Avenue 
c) 2 on Martha Avenue next to 969 McLean Avenue 
d) 2 on Kimball Avenue next to 929 McLean Avenue
e) 2 on Harding Avenue next to 866 McLean Avenue
f) 2 on Aqueduct Avenue next to 828 McLean Avenue
g) 2 in Coyne Park parking lot for the marchers at the end of the parade & the folks in the viewing stand
results.how_to_find_us: Let's inside or just outside of the Heritage Bar on McLean Avenue
results.name: Let's go to the St. Paddy's Day Parade in YONKERS on McLean Avenue

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 101
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays.
FEBRUARY- [MARCH 12, 19, 26, April 2] - APRIL -- 12:30pm

WHO CAN ATTEND:
Beginning guitar students who have no prior knowledge of how to play guitar, or people who can play, but are unfamiliar with how to read and play from written notes.  NOTE:  Session #1 is MANDATORY for participation in the Series.


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
Learn to READ and PLAY NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn is applicable to playing Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

MONTHLY, FOUR-WEEK CYCLES:
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

COST:  The cost of this session is $15.00, which must be paid when you RSVP. 


IMPORTANT NOTE: If there are 5 or less people registered for this meetup, we will not meet at Ripley Grier Studios.  We will instead meet at the Sony Public Atrium, 550 Madison Avenue (Between 55th and 56th Street on Madison).  Watch for an email confirming where we will meet.

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: C&B sets aside space for us from 12:30pm to 2:30pm so those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer if they wish.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at C&B, you will have to take a lesson from the range staff. If you are an experienced archer, you must at least stay for the safety portion (no exceptions, range rules). Lessons start at half past the hour so if you miss the 12:30pm, you may have to sit around and wait for the 1:30pm. Please be on time.

Public Transportation: LIRR to Hicksville and then a taxi from the station to C&B (make sure to tell them 11 Commercial St in Hicksville). The train from Penn gets into Hicksville at 11:55 am. The one-way cab rate as of 1/1/16 is roughly $6.30 (http://www.worldtaximeter.com/new-york/hicksville+train+station/440+jericho+turnpike%2C+hicksville) +$2 for each additional person. Those of you taking the train may wish to post a message to the group to share a cab.

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rates:

$7.00 for the first hour, $5 each additional hour OR $15 to shoot all day
$1.00 for a target
$11 per hour for a rental bow and arrows
$5.00 for a lesson (includes first hour)

Visit the C&B website for the most up-to-date information.

See you on the shooting line!

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
MORE INFO: https://www.whitney.org/Events/TailsWorkshops

REGISTER HERE* ->  https://visit.whitney.org/tickets/ItemList.aspx?node_id=183981
 

TAILS Workshop at The Whitney Museum: 

secure operating system training as part of Laura Poitras' ASTRONOISE exhibit.

photo credit Damon Winter/The New York Times

What is TAILS?
TAILS (The Amnesic Incognito Live System)
Tails is a live operating system, that you can start on almost any computer from a DVD, USB stick, or SD card. It aims at preserving your privacy and anonymity, and helps you to:

• use the internet anonymously and circumvent censorship.


• leave no trace on the computer you are using unless you ask it explicitly


• use state-of-the-art cryptographic tools to encrypt your files, emails, and instant messaging.

Attend this workshop in Downtown Manhattan's meatpacking district to learn more!

TELL ME MORE ABOUT THIS EVENT:

location: Floor Three, Susan and John Hess Family Theater

Join members of the Freedom of the Press Foundation, including data researcher Matthew Mitchell, David Huerta, co-organizer of CryptoPartyNYC, and artist Addie Wagenknecht for an afternoon of workshops on how to protect individual privacy in everyday life using TAILS, a fully-encrypted, privacy-preserving operating system. 

This event is produced in collaboration with Harlo Holmes, Freedom of the Press Foundation, and is part of a series of public events, lectures, and talks organized in tandem with ​Laura Poitras: Astro Noise​.

Saturday, March 19
1pm, 3 pm 

Advance registration is required, and includes admission to the Museum’s galleries. Please note: In order to take part in this workshop, each participant must bring a laptop computer on which they have administrator privileges and two blank flash drives.


REGISTER HERE*

 ---> 

https://visit.whitney.org/tickets/ItemList.aspx?node_id=183981

*:(

results.description:
Greetings everyone, I'd like to announce our first Ultimate Werewolf event since our Halloween event -which was a blast! First of all, thank you to all who attended our past "Werewolf In the Park" events, they've been great! For everyone else, it's never to late to get in on the fun -come one, come all, and tell your friends as well.

On Saturday, March 19th, we'll be returning to the event that is not unfamiliar to some of our members: Ultimate Werewolf.  Due to the possibility of cold weather, we'll be holding the event at the OSA Community Center -which we've used for a few of our other, general game days.  Ultimate Werewolf is a social game in which players are randomly assigned to one of two (or possibly more) teams: the villagers or the werewolves. The villagers must deduce who the werewolves are over a series of rounds using various techniques and social intrigue; this must be done before the werewolves are able to eliminate the villagers. For those of you who are unfamiliar with Ultimate Werewolf, check out Tom Vasel's review at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kr1ZyYycUdQ

Ultimate Werewolf is the perfect game for beginners and veterans alike! All you need is the game (which I will supply) and the willingness to communicate with others. Also, if you do not know how to play Ultimate Werewolf, never fear, it is quite simple and several of us will be able to teach it to you within minutes; don't let that hold you back! We'll be meeting at the OSA (Our Savior's Atonement) Community Center.  Enter on the Southern end of the building (left as you look at it) and take the stairs to the second floor.

Please note: while OSA is a Lutheran church, our group has no religious affiliation; we are renting the Community Center purely for purposes of table-top gaming.  Also, Because we are renting this community center, I must collect a fee of 8 dollars to cover the expenses.

Space is limited, so please DO NOT RSVP UNLESS YOU ARE FAIRLY CERTAIN THAT YOU CAN ATTEND!


OSA is located between the 181st street and 190th street lower-street level stops of the A-train; it is also very close to the 191st street stop of the 1-train. We hope to see you there! Message me if you need more information. Beginners and experts welcome


So bring along some snacks and (non- alcoholic) beverages (if you'd like) and prepare for an afternoon of team-deduction and social intrigue.  Hopefully you will not end up as the werewolf's next meal!
results.name: Ultimate Werewolf at OSA! (Long Overdue)

results.description:
It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.

Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

Facilitating the discussions will be Dr. Lonnie Edwards, Vice President of the EGL Board of Directors, and author of Spiritual Laws that Govern Humanity and the Universe.

(www.facebook.com/Spiritual.Laws)

Location will be Wholefoods in Tribeca.  

We will be on the second floor of whole foods where all the dining tables are located.  You will need to walk to the far end of the first floor, past the cashiers to take the stairs or elevator up to the second floor.  Please ask the employees if you have trouble finding it.  

Once upstairs, look for members with laptops, tablets, or phones with Hearthstone. We are hoping to secure one of the long wooden tables to accommodate our group but there is also a board game meetup and knitting club that might be occupying the space. If the long wooden tables are unavailable, we'll go to the back where all the glass windows are and arrange some tables and chairs together.

Ideal train to get here is the A,C,E,2,3 at Chambers Street. It's about 2 blocks from there. This space has lots of seating, and Wi-Fi is solid. It will require repeated login to their whole foods network every two hours.  You can also bring your phones for more consistent internet. If someone have room in their bag, please bring a surge protector so we can share with laptop users.

**Consider purchasing food/drink at this location to help support the business and space.

Hola! We will be reading the Spanish newspaper and discussing the news- in Spanish! This is great for beginners to advanced speakers! We will begin at 1:25 pm, so make sure to purchase a coffee or bite to eat before then.

-Spanish reading practice
-Spanish Pronunciation practice & correction
-Spanish conversation & debate after

This is great for anyone looking to start learning Spanish so you can expose yourself to the sounds of the language. Reading is the easiest, it is read just as it is written, unlike English. It will be $5 to join this event.

I will bring copies of the actual newspaper for the day. please only RSVP if you are serious about attending so I know how many copies to bring. Also, please make sure to purchase something to eat or drink at this venue.

results.description:
DON'T MISS OUR LAST UNDERGROUND HUNT OF THE YEAR!

As featured by ABC News and Time Out New York, explore what lies beneath the streets of the Big Apple for The Amazing New York Underground Scavenger Hunt. 

This fast-paced three-hour event is a hybrid scavenger hunt-obstacle course where you'll experience the fun & excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line.  

Each member of the winning group receives a New York City gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

*GET TICKETS HERE ($25 early bird, price will go up to $35) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0130PM

*No tickets sold at door. Must Prepay. 75+ members attended our last Scavenger Hunt!  

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed in a group or you can sign up with friends.  

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0130PM

*Prepay only. No tickets sold at door. 

Who can attend? All are welcome. Not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? It's underground so the race still goes on. 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 

Where do I get a ticket? Must prepay to attend. Tickets not sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing UNDERGROUND Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

venue.name: Slattery's Midtown Pub , New York, NY 10016

results.description:
***10 SPOTS AVAILABLE, RSVP's CLOSE MARCH 11th***

Edenworks is a Brooklyn-based urban farming business that's been growing as fast as its plants. The company has a shared vision for a localized agricultural infrastructure in New York City and beyond - which is a vision we definitely share in the Think Tank!

Last week, I had the chance to chat with Edenworks' founder, Jason Green. Jason is one of the most committed and visionary people I've met so far in the urban farming environment, and we dove into many of the topics that the Think Tank has addressed in recent weeks.

Jason and the Edenworks team have a fantastic vision for where the business will go in coming months and years, and he was gracious enough to invite some Think Tankers for a tour of the Edenworks facilities on March 19th. We'll be able to get an up-close and personal look at what the company does, as well as where it's headed, in the same facilities that it grows its plants.

There are a max of 10 spots left for the tour, though, and the cutoff date for RSVP's is March 11th, so make sure you snag a spot quickly.
results.how_to_find_us: 1 block from the Montrose Ave L train stop
results.name: EXTERNAL: Weekend Tour of Edenworks Urban Farm

results.description:
Join us for a small-group screening of this amazing movie, followed by a discussion. We'll have some up-to-date information and ways to take immediate action so that YOU can make a difference.

About the Movie
“In the spring of 2005, acclaimed environmental photographer James Balog headed to the Arctic on a tricky assignment for National Geographic: to capture images to help tell the story of the Earth’s changing climate. Even with a scientific upbringing, Balog had been a skeptic about climate change. But that first trip north opened his eyes to the biggest story in human history and sparked a challenge within him that would put his career and his very well-being at risk….

With a band of young adventurers in tow, Balog began deploying revolutionary time-lapse cameras across the brutal Arctic to capture a multi-year record of the world’s changing glaciers. His hauntingly beautiful videos compress years into seconds and capture ancient mountains of ice in motion as they disappear at a breathtaking rate. Chasing Ice depicts a photographer trying to deliver evidence and hope to our carbon-powered planet.”

Discussion After the Movie
Dr. Debra Tillinger will bring us up to date on the latest information regarding ice-melt and sea level rise and lead a discussion. Dr Tillinger has spoken at one of our general meetings and she is a great presenter, so we're glad she's available to talk about the film after the showing. She teaches a course on climate change science at the AMNH. Here's a description of her course and a short bio:
http://www.amnh.org/learn-teach/adults/adult-courses/our-earth-s-future-understanding-climate-science-and-sea-level-rise

RSVP HERE ON MEETUP OR ON FACEBOOK

https://www.facebook.com/events/1678802322336829/
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor at Patagonia Soho store
results.name: Film Screen and Discussion: Chasing Ice

results.description:
Switch: How to Change Things When Change Is Hard   

-by Chip Heath



Why is it so hard to make lasting changes in our companies, in our communities, and in our own lives?

The primary obstacle is a conflict that’s built into our brains, say Chip and Dan Heath, authors of the critically acclaimed bestseller Made to Stick. Psychologists have discovered that our minds are ruled by two different systems—the rational mind and the emotional mind—that compete for control. The rational mind wants a great beach body; the emotional mind wants that Oreo cookie. The rational mind wants to change something at work; the emotional mind loves the comfort of the existing routine. This tension can doom a change effort—but if it is overcome, change can come quickly.

In Switch, the Heaths show how everyday people—employees and managers, parents and nurses—have united both minds and, as a result, achieved dramatic results: 

●   The lowly medical interns who managed to defeat an entrenched, decades-old medical practice that was endangering patients.

●   The home-organizing guru who developed a simple technique for overcoming the dread of housekeeping.

●   The manager who transformed a lackadaisical customer-support team into service zealots by removing a standard tool of customer service

In a compelling, story-driven narrative, the Heaths bring together decades of counterintuitive research in psychology, sociology, and other fields to shed new light on how we can effect transformative change. Switch shows that successful changes follow a pattern, a pattern you can use to make the changes that matter to you, whether your interest is in changing the world or changing your waistline.

-from Amazon.com

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0030DHPGQ/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?ie=UTF8&btkr=1
results.name: Switch: How to Change Things When Change Is Hard   -by Chip Heath

results.description:
As many of us approach the retirement chapter of life it can be helpful to look into the different types of living arrangements that are available, at least until I am able to start our own "Meetup retirement community"! 

As this tour is limited to 10 people, the Fellowship does schedule regular tours if you are unable to attend this one. The tour is approximately one hour with a time after  for questions. For more info or other dates for tours call[masked] ext. 2 and ask for Kathy.

MEET IN THE FELLOWSHIP BUILDING:

Pull in main entrance on Hungry Hollow Rd.

GO down and up the hill.

Take your third right turn (follow signs for Fellowship Bldg.) and park at building in lot. 

DIRECTIONS:

Highway:

New York State Thruway to Garden State Parkway, South. Take First Exit on Right - "Red Schoolhouse Road". Turn Right at the Traffic Light at end of off Ramp. Red Schoolhouse Rd. 1.4 miles to Chestnut Ridge Rd. Turn Left. 3/10th mile on Chestnut Ridge to Hungry Hollow Rd.  

Local Roads:

 From Nanuet area, or the NYS Thruway exit 14:

Take Route 59 West to Route 45 Turn Left onto Route 45 South Rt. 45 (Becomes Chestnut Ridge Road) 2.1 miles on Rt 45/Chestnut Ridge Rd. to Hungry Hollow Rd.  

 From Suffern Area Route 59 East:

Turn Right onto Rt 45 South Rt. 45 (Becomes Chestnut Ridge Road) to Hungry Hollow Rd. on your right.

 A Little something about the community from their website:

"Fellowship" grows when people are working for the good of others. A working community is the result. Each of us is learning and mastering new skills like caring for an elderly person, milking a cow, planting and harvesting a garden, cooking a meal for 100 people, fixing a leaky faucet, baking bread, binding books, making cheese, joining wood, dipping candles, mowing lawns, making a web page... to name a few. And in all these work activities we try to better ourselves for the sake of a stronger community. 

Then there's the other kind of work we do here: The work of aging. Learning new ways to serve with a diminishing body and an expanding soul and spirit.

Everyone here at "The Fellowship", young and old, is working and learning to become her or his truest self, to best serve the community of man.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
We had briefly taken this off the schedule to deal with a scheduling conflict.  It is back on as originally scheduled.

Micro-controllers, especially the Arduino are a fundamental tool for any number of projects.  In this class we're going to learn the basics of several essential maker skills as we make an Arduino powered lapel pin.  Specifically we'll be:

• Programming Arduino type Micro-controllers(DigiSpark ATTiny85s to be specific)


• Soldering LEDs to them


• Studying and understanding datasheets


• Activating low-level features on micro-controllers, specifically the Arduino's power saving mode


This is a good basic introduction and suitable for absolute beginners as well as those who may have worked briefly with them at some point.

LAPTOPS are required for this class.  Please pre-install the software from https://www.arduino.cc/en/main/software ;

 Admission price includes three-hour workshop, component pack, and a DigiSpark micro-controller development board.  No other components are needed, though a shirt or jacket is recommended for maximum enjoyment. 


About your instructors

Andy Fundinger is a professional Python developer and trainer.  He's been programming for almost 28 years and in Python for 8 years.  This is the fourth time he's teaching Arduino for Beginners at MakerBar.

Mike Lowry is a MakerBar Member with special interests in robotics.  He often collaborates on our woodworking classes.

MakerBar Member price $15.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]  


MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!  


Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace. 


http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
Greetings all Brooklyn Ifa Members:

This coming Saturday in Brooklyn, I am having a meet and greet as well as an introduction of ifa.   There are several things that I would like to discuss with serious members as well as those that are just in what ifa is all about. 


I would like to see you come out and be a part of an informative discussion full of culture, wisdom and knowledge that is still flourishing and useful in today's society. Ifa is used in every day life - in birth, death, business, sports and you name it! Ifa is active all the time leading us to our destiny and being a seeing eye dog for those that are in the dark.  (May we never be in the dark). Ase. 


Come out, bring you loved one, or just come out and say hello as we discuss ifa.  I will also be introducing new classes, which I think you all will be interested in.  How do we communicate with our Orisa? How do we communicate with our ancestors? What is is ifa? Who is Orunmila? Is God sleeping? What are the Orisa - what do they do? What is a Babalawo? Wha do they do.


I hope to see you come out for a fun lecture and meetup event!


Babalawo Adaabala

results.description:
The Jewish Museum has free admission on Saturdays.  And they have an exhibit of Isaac Mizrahi.  Let's go check it out!

There is a free audio tour that you can download as well.  If you want to do this before you arrive, maybe you can do it while you're in a wifi zone!  (for those of us like me who are data usage phobic!)  If you go to this link, you will see towards the bottom of the page where you can download to either Android or iOS ... http://thejewishmuseum.org/exhibitions/isaac-mizrahi-an-unruly-history#about

Isaac Mizrahi: An Unruly History is the first museum exhibition to focus on the influential American fashion designer, artist, and entrepreneur. On view from March 18 to August 7, 2016, the exhibition explores Isaac Mizrahi’s unique position at the intersection of high style and popular culture. While best known for his clothing designs, Mizrahi’s creativity has expanded over a nearly three decade career to embrace acting, directing, set and costume design, writing, and cabaret performance. Spanning his first collection in 1988 to the present day, An Unruly History weaves together the many threads of his prolific career, juxtaposing work in fashion, film, television, and the performing arts.


Isaac Mizrahi’s inventive and provocative style advances complex issues within the fashion arena, igniting a spirited discourse about high versus low, modern glamour, and contemporary culture. For example, his runway shows were cast with unconventionally beautiful models of all ethnicities dressed in Star of David belts, Western-wear infused handmade lace, Adidas sneakers in place of high heels, handbags worn as hats, or humble cotton undershirts paired with floor-length taffeta skirts. Uniting opposites is a Mizrahi signature, which arises in his many combinations of evening and sportswear, formal and casual, and couture and mass market.

Isaac Mizrahi: An Unruly History is organized thematically, exploring key trends in Mizrahi’s work — from the use of color and prints, to witty designs that touch on issues of race, religion, class, and politics. The core of the exhibition features iconic designs from the Isaac Mizrahi New York clothing label (1987 – 1998), the “semi-couture” collections (2003 – 2011), and the trailblazing line for Target (2002 – 2008). The show is comprised of 42 “looks” that include clothing, hats, jewelry, shoes, accessories, and costumes for the theater, the opera, and the Mark Morris Dance Group. Also featured are the designer’s original drawings, performance stills, and behind-the-scenes photographs. A bespoke multi-screen video installation showcases a variety of content drawn from film and television cameos and runway shows, as well as from the award-winning documentary Unzipped; the television program The Isaac Mizrahi Show; scenes from the cabaret LES MIZrahi; appearances on Project Runway; and the current QVC network show IsaacMizrahiLive!.

You are invited to join the next meetup.Our meditation meetups are conducted by Dhammakaya meditation instructors, and practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teach meditation and Dhamma(reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. Though many of us are aware that meditation can help with stress, there is still so much more to learn from the benefits of meditating. We constantly need to be reminded and encouraged to meditate, otherwise it is easy to forget how meditating can be beneficial to our overall well being.

results.description:
Our monthly meetup to discuss two articles. If you would like to suggest an article, please do so in the comments below. RSVPs will open two weeks before day of meetup.  Priority on the waitlist will be given to individuals who have previously contributed to good discussion, posted a thoughtful comment or suggested an article.


This month's topic is love and all its varieties. Topic discussions will include:  how has love changed on a historic level? What is different today about courtship & romantic engagements? How has views and expectations of marriage changed in the previous decades? What is the impact on family & children? What are forms of non-romantic love that are important to a society and individuals? 

Topic 1:

All the Single Ladies: Recent years have seen an explosion of male joblessness and a steep decline in men’s life prospects that have disrupted the “romantic market”

http://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2011/11/all-the-single-ladies/308654/

supplemental reading: 

http://spr.sagepub.com/content/early/2015/09/30/0265407515607647.full.pdf+html


http://spr.sagepub.com/content/27/1/117.full.pdf+html


Topic 2: 

A: A Question of Moral Radicalism


http://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/05/opinion/a-question-of-moral-radicalism.html


B: Three Views of Marriage

http://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/23/opinion/three-views-of-marriage.html
results.name: Monthly Meetup: Love

results.description:
We've been on hiatus for a bit, but we're back with a visit to Repetorio! El Quijote is an adaptation of the classic tale, which evokes a satirical tone closer to Cervantes' original intent in contrast to other adaptations such as Man of La Mancha.

“ ‘El Quijote’ stresses the absurdities of Don Quijote’s quest, as he attempts to right wrongs and rescue damsels in distress… Don Quijote and Sancho stumble through a series of adventures (or misadventures, as Sancho calls them). Company members never falter, never miss a step. At the same time, the director’s creativity is unbounded.” – Backstage - 

See more at: http://repertorio.nyc/#/event/a0SE[masked]XC2MAM
results.name: Experience: El Quijote at Repertorio

Free Group Healing: Opening to the Transformation of Spring

March 19th, 3pm @ Opera America

Please follow this link provided below to register and secure your ticket.  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/opening-to-the-transformation-of-spring-free-group-healing-tickets-19370376317

Spring is coming with all of its transformative power.  To truly be open to Spring's potential, we have to be willing to let go of our old insecurities to step into something new. We all feel ready for Spring, but are we really open to the transformation that comes with it? We tend to cling to these old patterns because they feel safe compared to the unknown. 

Join Lorraine Goldbloom as she facilitates a free group healing to help let go of insecurity.  Insecurity is a universal issue, and it prevents us from realizing our full potential.  This healing will focus on re-patterning, balancing and harmonizing the system to help open your system to the new possibilities that come with Spring.

VortexHealing® is an extraordinary healing modality that works through consciousness and matter.  It focuses on healing and the acceleration of spiritual awakening.  The event is free but registration is required.  Please arrive on time.

This event is open to everyone and their guests, feel free to share this invitation.The event is FREE of charge, but registration at Eventbrite.com is required as space is very limited. Once you have registered, you will receive an email from Eventbrite.com confirming your registration and ticket. You must print the ticket you receive in the confirmation email and bring it with you. THIS TICKET IS REQUIRED FOR ADMITTANCE. Doors will close promptly at 3:15pm. Please arrive on time.

Looking forward to seeing you at the event.

Lorraine Goldbloom  VortexHealing® Teacher

results.description:
Please state what you'll be playing in your RSVP to make it easy to track.

Here's a list of some stuff we have been playing at the last several jams.

Big Boss Man

Bertha

Ramble on Rose

Sugaree

Cold Rain and Snow

GDTRFB

Beat It On Down the Line

Friend of the Devil

Sugar Magnolia

Brokedown Palace

What we haven't been doing is working on some of the bigger jam vehicle tunes. We should make a spot in the third hour just after the 'Safety Meeting in the Stairwell' jam to bust out an Eyes, Dark Star, ScarletFire, etc.

We should go through these until we devolve into the usual 'call something out clockwise setlist'

I'll sign up for drums. If another drummer signs up I will rent the congas and split the time. If two bass players sign up, we will look into another room.
results.name: Workingman's Monthly Electric Jam

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above.


I'll usually let everyone know by Wednesday which room we'll be in on Saturday.

The rooms cost $70 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.
results.name: Play Jazz!

results.description:
At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of lessons @ $22 per lesson (1 hr) = $110 Total Cost


Session 1 (Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay by Debit or Credit using Venmo to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 3/19/16; 3/26/16 (Easter No Lesson); 4/2/16; 4/9/16; 4/16/16; 4/23/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. (Session 2 will progress members)

In 4 short months we have Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Please do not abuse this!) 

Ladies Get your Swim Caps here? Your girl just came through! MySwimCap.com just granted discounts. Their swim-cap is made by a black woman for black women & they're a hit. Btw didn't know that wen I bought mine 2 years ago but they're the best I've seen on the market.

I will share the code with those who have paid. It's $5 off the $24.99 Price tag :-) Super excited - Great gift Item. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMPGp25VOkk

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315
results.name: I won't drown Swim Challenge

group.name: ! Black People Who Love The Outdoors and Adventure NY

results.description:
Join us for figure drawing session in Ukrainian Village.


This meetup is open to sketchers of all levels. 

Why are we different? 


• Large, well lit, and quiet space on a second floor of a secure building. 

•[masked] minute poses. Model takes a break every 20 min.

• Latecomers are ok.

• Mingle, look at each other's work during the break and get inspired. Nobody will judge you. All levels and drawing styles are welcome and your artistry is appreciated.

How it works?

• We draw for 3 hours from a live (nude) model.  

• We warm up with 5 minute poses and work all the way up to 20 minute poses by the end. Model takes 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone at the tables. 

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• BYOM - Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint or sprays).

If you have any questions please feel free to email me. I'm looking forward to meeting you there. 


Phillip
results.how_to_find_us: We are in Manhattan (2nd Ave at 13th St)
results.name: Life Figure Drawing - Ukrainian Village

The street action will begin around 3:00pm and end close to 630pm. This week's action will be followed by an important business meeting and/or continued action at locations TBD.

results.description:
This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers. Depending on how many people sign up to come and to share their work at this meeting, we will divide the group into two tables. A "fiction writers" table and a "non-fiction writers" table.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.

Here is how we will divide the tables if needed:

1) Fiction writers: Genres covered are literary/upscale/art fiction, poetry, all kinds of mysteries, speculative fiction (fantasy, urban fantasy, horror and sci-fi), chick lit, women fiction, romance (all kinds, including historical, regent, sexy and erotica), western.

2) Non-fiction writers: Genres covered are all kids of non-fiction, autobiographies and memoires, academic non-fiction, news articles, blogs, poetry, non-fiction screenplays etc.
results.how_to_find_us: You can't miss us :)
results.name: Hudson Writers Meeting

results.description:
A fun afternoon of scrapbooking. I can host up to 6 people at the Crafty Game Cave nice and cozy.  With streaming Youtube videos all night long to get the creative juices flowing.

As a Stampin Up Demonstrator you are more than welcome to try out products from my stash.  Maybe you will use something you just gotta buy one for yourself ;)

Also on hand are the Cricut Expression (bring your mats & cartridges), a few Big Shot(s) and Martha Stewart scoreboards.  So bring your dies and embossing folders.

* I will have some beverages on hand! (Water, Soda, Juice we can make coffee or tea)  You are more than welcome to bring snacks if you please.  I have a microwave and a fridge at your disposal.  We are also local to many take out/delivery restaurants for food if you feel like ordering  I have some menus for your options.

Great, well cannot wait for some crafty company :)
results.name: Scrapbooking Afternoon Social...Weekend Edition!

results.description:
Nick, Dave, Kris and the rest of the 20-Somethings invite other 20-something LGBTIQA's and Allies to join them at Hanover Lanes on Saturday, March 19th for an afternoon of fun! 

Each game will cost $5.25, and Hanover Lanes charges $3 per person for shoe rental. 

There is a snack bar inside the alley that offers pizza, chicken strips, fries, sodas...and you know, all the stuff Mom said not to eat. 

There is no "end time" for this event, but we plan to bowl three games. 

If you are over 30 and wish to bowl, please let us know when you RSVP, and we will do our best to assemble a second "team."  We already have two or three members over thirty who have expressed interest.  Perhaps we ought to set up an "Over 30" team and perhaps challenge the 20-Somethings to a showdown!
results.name: 20-Somethings Go Bowling!

Stay tuned for the venue. Hope to see you in a couple of weeks! Katie

You are living by design or by default - come to the next meeting and create your "target."

results.description:
Please join us for:

Dornroeschen

"Als Fee wurde ich nicht eingeladen, darum denke ich nur: Wie kann ich schaden? So wird man böse wenn man ausgeschlossen. Mein Herz hab ich jetzt fest verschlossen“. Dies singt die 13. Fee bevor sie Röschen verflucht. Nur ein Kuss wahrer Liebe kann Dornröschen nun noch retten und den Fluch aufheben. A wicked fairy, upset for not being invited to the royal celebration, casts a spell on Princess Rose. Will the right prince come and bestow the kiss that wakes the sleeping princess?

Appropriate for children ages 4 to 9, the show is and filled with music and song delighting audiences young and old. As with all of Galli Theater’s shows, Dornröschen gives the young audience opportunities to engage the characters in the Performance.

This is a German language event for the whole family brought to you by the Galli Theater and CityKinder! The 2 hour event includes a Galli Theater Workshop, face painting, an enchanted craft and of course the performance of a German Fairy Tale by the Galli Theater (stay tuned for programming)

This event tends to sell out. Please book your tickets early!


Tickets: $25 per child | $20 per adult 

Please register here:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/event-gallis-marchenfestival-presented-by-citykinder-dornroschen-tickets-19960747132

RSVP REMINDER:

If you are interested in attending this event, please remember that RSVPs close on Friday, March 18 at 10 p.m. We already have a "full house" but a few more of you are welcome.

$4.00 organizer fee, in cash at the door

ALSO: Last call for those of you who would like free sheet music! We'd be happy to bring some to Jacques Torres, but you need to let us know ASAP. Retails below.

See you there,

Anna, Lourdes and Hayley

Hello, fellow chocoholics!

Let's meet at Jacques Torres to welcome the Spring, socialize with STSANY members and friends and indulge our obsession for chocolate! 

Come for a purely social, fun excursion to one of New York's hot spots! You may bring a guest or two, but be sure to include them in your RSVP.

• Prizes and Surprises await you! 

• FREE SHEET MUSIC! Tell me what songs you'd like to have (that you haven't found), or types of music you're searching for, i.e., classical, jazz, Broadway, folk, more.... and we'll try to bring them to the meetup. We know some of you don't know where to look for sheet music (besides online for $$), since music stores are almost non-existent, and/or haven't succeeded in finding music you would really love to sing! Some of us have multiple copies, and would be happy to share them with you!

Jacques Torres is located at 285 Amsterdam Avenue, between West 73rd and 74th Streets:[masked]

Getting to Know You: This is a lovely way to get to know each other by sharing:

• PAST EXPERIENCES in singing, acting, dancing, playing an instrument, etc.;

• ANECDOTES about past teachers, support from friends and family (or not!), and what - and/or WHO - inspire you to perform;

• YOUR FAVORITE kind(s) of music and performers - past and present;

• YOUR PASSION and ASPIRATIONS for the arts, and goals as members of STSANY;

• "BRILLIANT" ideas for future STSANY workshops, performances, volunteer events and more. We are very interested in what you have to say, and welcome new organizers and volunteers for outreach events. Listen to: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4MNANgFCYpk - youtube song/Deborah Kerr/Marni Nixon

$4 organizer fee at the door (cash only)

• Reminder: To learn about STSANY, read "pages" for our goals and reviews; see past events; check out our photo albums; watch members perform on our youtube channel. More recent videos soon to be added: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

REVIEWS

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting many helpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___ P. Vincent, New York City actor and playwright (showcase performer)

Our caroling performance at the Dwelling Place Women's Shelter
on December 4th was a good, inspiring experience for me, and gave me a chance to sing and blend my voice in group. As a volunteer, I like to help out the community during the holiday season. When we were performing at the Esplanade, I felt that the audience reacted in a very positive, enthusiastic way. 
Sheri


Lourdes, Hayley and I can't wait to see you on March 19. New Members are especially welcome.

Note: Come to our next workshop for singers and actors on Thursday, March 24 at 6:00 p.m. RSVP on the posting.

Cheers,

Anna: Founder/Organizer of STSANY since 2010

www.annabartos.com

Sip on our famous hot chocolate, paired perfectly with a chocolate chip cookie, at Jacques’ third location in New York City’s Upper West Side. Featuring interior designs based on the great cafés of Europe, our shop will be a mini vacation from the hustle and bustle of your day.

results.description:
Transitioning from academia into industry can certainly seem like a daunting task; it is, however, entirely doable. As several members in our group had expressed interest in learning more about the process, this meetup will focus on the following key points:


+ Overview of the consulting landscape and different areas of consulting (e.g. management consulting, healthcare consulting).


+ My personal experience of recently having gone through the process (with more ups and downs than any Six Flags' roller coaster rides, trust me)


+ Q&A

Hope to see you there!

[About me: I received my PhD in cancer genetics; and while doing my postdoctoral fellowship at Weill Cornell/NY Presbyterian, I decided academia was not the right fit for me. I then entertained several career alternatives and consulting was the one I decided to actively pursue. After months of studying and going on multiple interviews, I got an offer to join a consulting firm and focus on the biotechnology/pharmaceuticals space.]

***The meeting space (room 122) has been confirmed for:

Saturday March 19, 2016 from 4:00 pm - 5:30 pm

The room should be unlocked and ready for your meeting.
If it is NOT please proceed to room 121 (right next door)
results.name: Consulting 101

results.description:
Open Mic For Democracy Spring!

Come join us at this fun Open Mic this Saturday for Democracy Spring!

If you haven't heard, there is a mass nonviolent action happening this April. On April 2nd, people will march from the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia to the Capitol in Washington D.C. From April 11th to April 16th over two thousand people will participate in a mass sit-in to get money out if politics by getting Congress to take urgent action. If you're interested in signing up for this mass civil disobedience, you can do so here.

We want to ensure that everyone, no matter their socio-economic class, is able to participate in the march and/or sit in. That's why on March 19th from 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. we are going to have an Open Mic Fundraiser at the NY Society for Ethical Culture. Tickets are $10.00 online or $10.00 cash at the door. This will be a great chance to meet other activists, artists, and people interested in getting money out of politics. Money in politics is strongly related to politicians supporting private interests (such as the oil and gas industry) instead of the interests of Americans. One hundred percent of the proceeds will be going to Democracy Spring. I would really love it if you came and supported this important action. Also, if you or someone you know would be interested in performing, please feel free to reach out to me at this email: [masked]

You can get your tickets here:
Eventbrite link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/democracy-spring-open-mike-tickets-22638161350
results.name: Open Mic For Democracy Spring

results.description:
Please join us for this at 4pm at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair).


This week we will practice Tai Chi led by Joel Friedman. Joel's popular sessions are an interactive introduction to using Tai chi to create a higher level of meditative “listening” both within the individual and with a partner.

We will use walking and stepping as a meditative exercise to create internal balance; yin yang meditative hand movements to create awareness of internal balance of energy and two person exercises to develop listening skills with respect to the internal energy of the other.

This form of listening can be incorporated into all aspects of life ranging from enhancing tefilla, interpersonal communication, sports, health, meditation and self-defense. Led by Joel Friedman,  MD, PhD, scientist (Professor, Albert Einstein College of Medicine), mystic, thirty year practitioner and teacher of tai chi and other Chinese internal martial arts.

Most weeks are meditation led by a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com
results.name: Shabbat Tai Chi

results.description:
Let's meet at Manhattan's Upper East Side Whole Foods at[masked]rd Ave (at 88th street). There's an eat in area on the mezzanine floor. Please purchase fruit or salad (at least part of your meal) from Whole Foods so we will be welcome there in the future. Since raw fruit and salad is the basis of the 80/10/10 diet, let's support each other by having food together that falls within 80/10/10 guidelines. 80/10/10 beverages include water, coconut water and some occasionally have juices.

This Whole Foods has a weird layout. Most of the produce is on level 2 which you can get to by escalator. There are only two check out lines at street level (level 1) yet many cashiers so the sometimes long lines usually move quickly. Once done with your purchase you can get to the eat in area on the mezzanine level by walking up the stairs near the 87th street exit. The store doesn't allow you to enter on 87th street.

If you want to check in with us first, it's not as obvious how to get to the mezzanine level. You can enter on 88th street and take the elevator to the mezzanine level once in the store. The escalators don't even go to this in between mezzanine level, only to levels 1 and 2. There is also a small opening to pass near the check out lines but that can be hard to find.

Please avoid wearing fragrances as several people in our group are sensitive to them including myself.

I will post my cell phone number in the comments the day before the event so you can contact me if you have trouble finding us or want to know if we are still there. :)

Please note this is different than a common past location on the east side.  It is NOT the East 57th street one, it's at 88th Street and 3rd Avenue.
results.how_to_find_us: If taking subway, the closest one is 86th and Lexington and the 4,5 and 6 stop there.  I will post my phone number in the comments the day before the meetup so if you have trouble finding us once there you can call me.

results.description:
We're bringing back our popular format this month here at BFTVC: All Full Court Evening. We'll have 3 teams of 7, with two subs, and rotate the teams around to play full court games all evening.

And as usual:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Walls, and ceiling are out of bounds. 


3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
Saturday's sessions are a little slower paced and a good opportunity to work on basic techniques (rolling, ball handling, etc.) and just have fun. The pace may pick up, depending on the group, but new players will be incorporated into the play. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first.)

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
A Shamanic journey of ancient remembering. A healing ceremony of the Soul lead by Kevon Simpson.


What is Light Of Iris?

Love Includes Growing Heights Together of Integration Responsibility Intuition and Simplicity. Light of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that uses meditation, journaling, dance, drawing, music, and .... more to help facilitate lasting emotional healing and a permanent expansion of consciousness. For some that means increased creativity, for others that can mean healing deeply repressed childhood wounds in a matter of hours, for some it can mean reawakening a connection to ones ancestors and their power. It is named after my late Great Grandmother Iris Palmer who came to me in a vision as pure light during a previous ceremony. I don't have the right words to describe the impact that had on me, but we do want to share that possibility with others. This is about remembering who you are and standing in that power.

To honor the privacy of our participants. No further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation. Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list.

We love you :-) ♥,
Team Iris

results.description:
THE WHO: North American Tour
The Rock ‘n’ roll gods "The Who" have always stood out from the pack with their wild onstage antics. Known for smashing guitars, swinging microphones around, jumping off amplifiers, and blowing up drum kits, the band has always represented the pinnacle of rebellious rock genius. 

Their larger-than-life performances are evenly matched by their huge sound, and classics like “My Generation”, “Pinball Wizard”, and “Won’t Get Fooled Again” are still played with thunderous force. For The Who Hits 50! Tour, the group is bringing their trademark monolithic grandeur and kinetic energy to stages around the world.

Ticket buyers should be ready for an awe-inspiring show!
You definitely wouldn't want to miss any opportunity to see 'The Who Hits 50! Roger & Pete still have plenty of kick left...They run through all the cool songs from 'back in the day'. Very entertaining! 

Opening act(s As of now: : Joan Jett and The Blackhearts with special guest Miley Cyrus

You've been suspicious of your neighbor for some time. An opportunity arises and you sneak into his apartment. Suddenly, the door closes behind you, you are trapped in. He can not find you there when he gets back. Can You Escape?


Our team of 8 will be locked in the fully themed room. The clock starts as soon as we enter. We have 60 heart pounding minutes to solve the puzzles, find the clues, and get out. We need to think outside of the box and think fast. CAN WE ESCAPE? They say that many will try, but few succeed.

Website: http://www.canyouescapeli.com/rooms.html - We are playing "The Apartment"


• No one under age 18


• RSVPing does not guarantee you a spot - you must PayPal ***via friends and family*** $34 to Tina at: paypal.me/Nystedt/34 to secure your spot (or meet up with me at another event prior to pay) - the first 8 members to pay are reserved! We have 5 paid members so far--will you join us on this adventure?

• No refunds.

I've done room escapes 3 times are they are a lot of fun. It's similar to playing a video game that requires solving puzzles like Myst. There are also several room escape type games for the phone such as "The Room" if you would like to get an idea of what it's like.

Please feel free to message me (Melissa Frank) with any questions. See you there!

results.description:
Creative Visualization an age old technique that uses the power of your thoughts and imagination to clarify your dreams and desires and take forward steps to achieving them.
So lately there been a lot people saying things like;
"Your thoughts create your reality","be careful what you wish for", "thoughts become things"
Well, there's some truth to these statements. On a day to day basis most of us are kind of flying by the seat of our pants when it comes to moving towards making our dreams and desires come to fruition.
Creative visualization is one of many powerful and effective techniques that bears results. For the next gathering, let's spend some time learning the basics of the creative visualization technique, let's take some steps together towards physically manifesting what it is we want!
We'll try out a few simple exercises, including intentions, affirmations and meditation to experience the process of creative visualization. By the end of this session you will have mastered the basics enough to use this powerful technique in your daily life...
Let's explore together, this will be one more tool in the tool bag of your inner development...
Sounds interesting right? Join Us!

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor.

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

results.description:
Light and Shadow in Balance: Time for fresh Magick!

Although Winter made only a cameo appearance this year, we all look forward to a long run of the season of Spring. Celebrate Alban Eilir with Grailwood Coven, drink of the Elixir of Life and prepare for prosperity, health and new found promise.

Selkie Lyrazel

This ritual and feast takes place on Saturday, the 19th of March at 7:00 pm. Plan to gather at 358 W 44th Street, the Producers Club Theatres, Midtown NY (between eighth and ninth avenue but much closer to ninth,) If possible bring food or libations to add to the feasting.

A contribution of $10 is asked to help defray expenses

Questions? Drop us a line at: [masked]
results.name: Grailwood Coven's Vernal Equinox ritual

results.description:
Have you always wanted to try out the the pottery wheel but not quite ready to sign up for an entire session? This one time introductory class lets you get your hands dirty on the wheel without the time commitment. 

You will experience how thrilling it is to get the clay spinning on the wheel while we explain the basics of centering and pulling up the walls of the clay. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/ejKFFK
results.name: Intro to Pottery Wheel Class!

venue.name: New York RUDANCENY Ballroom Dance School

results.description:
We welcome all dance lover join this Satuday Soical dance party. You can learn Latin dance (Chacha, Samba, Rumba, Swing, Salsa), Ballroom dance (Waltz, Tang , Foxtrot, Quickstep, etc.) and popular social dance with professional dance instructors. You also can meet friends and have social net working.

This event features free dance party from 6 - 7 PM
$15 Social dance party from 7 - 11 PM
FREE class from 7 - 8 PM

Light refreshments and drinks will be served. 

Purchase the tickets by following link:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/saturday-social-dance-party-tickets-16645146080
results.name: Saturday Social Dance Party!

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 members will be attending the dance class and 300+ members will be attending the party. 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor. 

https://vimeo.com/157975729


Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available): https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0700PM

Cost: $35, includes dance class 7-8pm and cover at the door for the party (21+)

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned. That's over 3 hours of dancing!

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  300+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s)

Prepay Here - https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0700PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event. Expect 30-40 members to attend the dance class and over 300 people attending the party. It is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. 

Let's party! :)

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.
results.name: Learn How To Dance @ 230 Fifth (Includes entry to 'Spring Fling' After Party)

results.description:
Greetings, Dons and Donnas,

It is once again time to open up the...back room...of the famous Clyde House for the third annual GPD Casino Night fundraiser.

Same drill as last year: $10 gets you in the door with $5 worth of chips, which you can do with what you will. I'm not saying you can use them for Blackjack, Craps, or advanced and beginner Hold'em, that's entirely up to you with no skin off my back.

More of those chips can be exchanged for 25 cents a chip, if you feel like buying small clay circles for some reason. Of course, exchanges work both ways, if you are at any time finished with them.

If at any time bright flashing lights start shining in the windows, you can quickly grab one of the many board games that do not require the transfer of chips.

Drinks and light snacks will be provided. There are lots of friendly businesses that are under the protection of Papa Blair, and will kindly deliver to Clyde House, if you require something more substantial.

Clyde House is a classy joint, so conduct yourself accordingly, or your kneecaps might have an unfortunate run-in with some lead.

All proceeds go to funding this May's Geek Pride Day. I won't even take my normal cut, since I'm such a swell guy.

See you round the corner,
Mike the Yeti
results.name: 3rd Annual GPD Casino Night

venue.address_1: 568 BAY STREET, STATEN ISLAND, NY 10301, 2ND. FLOOR
venue.name: DANCE CENTRAL NEW YORK INC.

results.description: The beginner class will start at 7:00 p.m. and run for about a half hour to 45 minutes. The Social will begin right after the beginner class and  will run for about 45 minutes. Nunzi will be playing your favorite salsa and cha cha cha. See you on the dance floor.
results.how_to_find_us: DANCE CENTRAL NEW YORK INC. SECOND FLOOR. GO UP THE STAIRS AND TURN TO THE RIGHT. STUDIO WILL BE DIRECTLY AHEAD
results.name: FREE BEGINNER SALSA CLASS & DANCE SOCIAL ON 3-19-16 @ DANCE CENTRAL NEW YORK INC

results.description:
Joe Hurley returns to NYC after a two year absence with his Irish Rock Revue.
Tickets go on sale February 11th and can be purchased through the Highline Ballroom website or ticketweb.com
Doors open at 6 PM.
SHOW begins at 7 PM. 


Hosted by Joe Hurley & Edward Rogers, the Irish Rock Revue has seen 18 years of extraordinary guests and overseas surprises incl:
Ronnie Spector, The High Kings, Gogol Bordello's Eugene Hutz, Laura Cantrell, Martha Wainwright, Michael Cerveris, Members of Flogging Molly, Patti Smith Band, The New York Dolls, Television, Fountains of Wayne, Gene Cornish of The Rascals, Tony Visconti, Alice Cooper Group, Nada Surf, The Crystals Lala Brooks, novelists Colum McCann, Pete Hamill, Alphie & Malachy McCourt...

"Gathering friends and performers from punk legends to Broadway Stars, best-selling novelists to star comedians, R&R Hall-Of Famers to downtown NYC luminaries & up and coming local singers, I recommend the same thing every year because it is clearly the best party of them all. Rogue's March maestro Joe Hurley puts on a raucous show called the All-Star Irish Rock Revue. If you havent been to one, you've yet to experience St Pat's in NYC. It's that simple "
THE IRISH VOICE

- See more at: http://highlineballroom.com/show/2016/03/19/joe-hurleys-all-star-irish-rock-revue/#sthash.EMKGaFzH.dpuf


VIP Reserved Seating * $60 - Front Row Balcony * $60 - Side Wing Booth * First Come, First Served General Admission - Standing Room * $25 Advance / $30 Day of Show * Limited Seating Available First Come, First Served * Full Dinner Menu Available * $10 Minimum Per Person, For All Tables *  

See more at: http://highlineballroom.com/show/2016/03/19/joe-hurleys-all-star-irish-rock-revue/#sthash.EMKGaFzH.dpuf
results.name: JOE HURLEY IRISH ROCK REVUE
