results.description:
It's been a while since we've been to Jujube Tree. The food is great and I am a huge fan of mock meats.

Jujube Tree is the only vegan restaurant in Astoria. They've received very nice reviews on Yelp:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/jujube-tree-astoria


The extensive menu shows a variety of dishes from all over Asia, including some with a twist, like Kale Avocado Bowl and Pumpkin Kimchee. And don't forget dessert- Pumpkin Cheesecake and Fudge Brownies. Yum!

A few reminders:
  
• If your plans change for the evening, please update your RSVP right away, so that I can change the reservation count.


• It's very helpful in paying the bill, if you can bring cash.

• Please show up on time. We'll wait a reasonable amount of time, but hope to be ordering at just about 7:15pm.
results.name: Dinner: Jujube Tree - Asian Vegan Cuisine

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 members will be attending! 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor. 

https://vimeo.com/157975729

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available): https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0700PM

Cost: $35, includes dance class 7-8pm and cover at the door for the party (21+)

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned. That's over 3 hours of dancing!

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  300+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s)

Prepay Here - https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Mar-19-2016_at_0700PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event. Expect 30-40 members to attend the dance class and over 300 people attending the party. It is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. 

Let's party! :)


What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.
results.how_to_find_us: please message with any questions
results.name: Learn How To Dance @ 230 Fifth (Includes entry to 'Spring Fling' After Party)

results.description:
Reserve your spot $25, 7 to 9 pm

http://www.namastebookshop.com/warrior-goddess-training-workshop-led-by-heatherash-amara/

Calling all warriors of love and goddesses of the heart.

Let's awaken our inner fire, women!

Women often fall into the habit of putting others before ourselves – partners, friends, family, children, and while we can move mountains to accomplish things for our loved ones, there can be a vacant hole left where we once held our own Warrior Goddess power. If you feel overwhelmed by your crazy life or judge yourself for falling short of perfection, you've probably learned to be your own worst critic rather than your own best friend. HeatherAsh’s Warrior Goddess Training book shares the antidote to the flawed idea that you are not enough. Direct, honest, and unapologetic, HeatherAsh will show you how to release the layers of expectations to finally see yourself for the authentic, perceptive, perfect woman you really are.

Whether you are new to the Warrior Goddess movement or you have been part of the community for years there will be something juicy for you in this evening gathering. HeatherAsh Amara is the author of the bestselling Warrior Goddess Training and the upcoming Warrior Goddess Way. She is dedicated to inspiring depth, creativity, and joy by sharing the most potent tools from a variety of world traditions. HeatherAsh studied and taught extensively with don Miguel Ruiz, author of The Four Agreements, and continues to teach with the Ruiz family.

Raised in Southeast Asia, HeatherAsh has traveled the world from childhood and is continually inspired by the diversity and beauty of human expression and experience. She brings this openhearted, inclusive worldview to her writings and teachings, which are a rich blend of Toltec wisdom, European shamanism, Buddhism, and Native American ceremony. She is the author of Warrior Goddess Training, The Toltec Path of Transformation and co-author of No Mistakes: How You Can Change Adversity into Abundance.

HeatherAsh Amara lives in Austin, Texas and travels extensively around the world, speaking and teaching workshops.

http://www.heatherashamara.com
results.name: Namaste Warrior Goddesses: Ignite your Inner Fire! with HeatherAsh Amara

results.description:
Have you always wanted to try out the the pottery wheel but not quite ready to sign up for an entire session? This one time introductory class lets you get your hands dirty on the wheel without the time commitment. 

You will experience how thrilling it is to get the clay spinning on the wheel while we explain the basics of centering and pulling up the walls of the clay. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/ejKFFK
results.name: Intro to Pottery Wheel Class!

results.description:
A night of science, spirituality, meditation and movement! The evening begins with Wenzl McGowen (co-founder of Moon Hooch) sharing his personal experience of multiple realities and a unified theory of paranormal phenomena through digital physics. Wenzl studied philosophy and music at The New School and has spoken at TED and TEDx. He is currently writing a book on digital physics. Then Joro-Boro and Keena will will perform as part of the sound project ErrorrE, which explores the intersection of sound, meditation and movement by merging the use of acoustic instruments (gongs, hang drums, bells), whispers, chanting, samples, and electronics in the format of a participatory ritual bass event. The evening concludes with a dance party. Special guest: Adam Robinson on Shakuhachi

Tickets: $10
Purchase Here: https://bridgeeventone.splashthat.com
results.name: Bridge Event: One

BYOB to savor this flavor all the more!  Please register at our website www.culturecabin.com so we can gather appropriate amounts of ingredients!

results.description:
Fantastic Meetup in February!! Join us again for an awesome night of music!


Welcome to all our new members! You add another dimension to our music! An outstanding blend of instruments and vocals all contributed to the awesome sound of some of the best music we've played! We'll be at Classic Quiche in Teaneck again, where the seats are comfortable & the music is hot!

Come early @ 6:00 PM and have dinner! For the full menu, go to www.classicquiche.com.  Experience has shown that all goes smoothly, if only the voices and bass plug in and the rest is acoustic. Do bring mics if you have them.  By all means, if you're playing a solo or finger-picking, temporary amplification is fine! 
We are a friendly, inviting and inclusive group--so join us! 
Download our latest BCAM Songbook by clicking on MORE then FILES section of the Meetup site.

**NOTES 
The restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, so BYOB!

A $5 cover charge will be collected from musicians, 100% of which goes to the venue. 

FOR ALL OTHERS, A $10 MINIMUM FOOD/BEVERAGE CHARGE WILL APPLY**

results.description:
Jimmy’s Hall (2014)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUQ9s2ex4HE

Directed by Ken Loach

Starring Jim Norton, Barry Ward & Francis Magee

In 1921 Jimmy Gralton's sin was to build a dance hall on a rural crossroads in an Ireland on the brink of Civil War. The Pearse-Connolly Hall was a place where young people could come to learn, to argue, to dream...but above all to dance
and have fun. As the hall grew in popularity its free-spirited reputation brought it to the attention of the church and politicians.


Saturday, March 19

FREE Tea, Coffee, Popcorn

If you love wine, wine lovers and socializing then join us for this great night out where the focus is on introducing you to some great wines!  We have teamed up with several social networking groups to bring you a fantastic wine tasting event for people who love wine and those who know nothing about it!  It is a fun way to spend a Friday evening in a classy yet casual atmosphere. The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$47 in advance only - Prepay here:

http://nysnvday2015.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The night will feature:

-A dozen top notch  wines selected by The World Bar/Madison & Vine Wine Bar wine experts for you to sample with descriptions of each.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers.

-NYSN staff to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-The bar will remain open for invited guests and wine tasting participants until midnight

What to wear: business casual, lounge

What to expect: 40-50 people. Most come on their own

Tickets are non refundable unless the event is canceled.

Address:

The World Bar
845 United Nations Plaza
Corner 1st ave and east 48th
New York, NY

results.description:
(Overnight Stay or as late as you would like to stay)

What Is Mitote Medicine?  A Mitote is a dream night in which healers and all community come together to sing, drum, dream, heal and dance together.  It has been passed down through Toltec Lineage to transform ones dreams into wakeful dreams, living dreams.

As you know we usually have this ritual twice a year, now it is time to have the dream manifest into an all night event. This ritual as am overnighter has manifested doors to open and create a safe haven for dreamtime, lucid dreaming, journeying and holding sacred space together. To bring Intention into the Mitote celebration with multi-dimensions interwoven together to allow Spirit to intervene and co-create with us.  

Throughout the night, we will take turns to experience lucid dreaming, and receive and give the healing which we all need.  Open to movement accompanied by sound, to heightened awareness and stalking our own power as we travel through the paradigm shift of self awareness as we lose our own personal history. 

Open to all levels of energy healers and those whom are just starting within the path.

Early Bird Registration until Feb. 28 $85 thereafter $125

For more information contact Irma at [masked]

A list of items to bring with you for the night will be given to those who register

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.  

This event is now full for guys, but we are still accepting women.  Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  

Grab friends and come along to The Wheeltapper Pub to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from [masked]) ; At anytime you can register at the New York EasyDates website for $25 with promo code MEETUP-25.  

If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

Regards, 

Daniel

Doors open at 7:30pm, show begins at 8:00.  Tickets are $18 (+ facility fee if purchased online) and must be purchased in advance to secure your seat.  You can purchase tickets at the door (no facility fee applies), but there's no guarantee the show won't be sold out by then.

Purchase your tickets here:  http://galleryplayers.com/

FOR THOSE OF WHO WHO'D LIKE TO GRAB A BITE BEFOREHAND, meet at the Prospect Bar and Grill 5:30ish.  The service isn't the fastest, so keep your order simple and get there as close to 5:30 as possible.  COMMENT BELOW YOU'LL BE EATING WITH US OR I WILL NOT RESERVE YOUR SEAT. 

Here's the menu:  http://www.prospectbarandgrill.com/

A charming rogue contrives to serve a short sentence in an airy mental institution rather in a prison. This, he learns, was a mistake. He clashes with the head nurse, a fierce martinet. Quickly, he takes over the yard and accomplishes what the medical profession has been unable to do for twelve years; he makes a presumed deaf and dumb Indian talk. He leads others out of introversion, stages a revolt so that they can see the world series on television, and arranges a rollicking midnight party with liquor and chippies. For one offense, the head nurse has him submit to shock treatment. The party is too horrid for her and she forces him to submit to a final correction a frontal lobotomy. 

"Scarifying and powerful." - N.Y. Times.

"Funny, touching, and exciting." - N.Y. Daily News.

"Brilliant. The stuff of great theatre." - WQR Radio

results.description:
The first time I created a vision board was in church...yes!! As part of a "Jericho March" which at the time was a corporate church activity. The late Bishop Wilbert Mckinley asked the entire congregation to craft personal visuals of the  petitions they constantly lay before God. We would march around the temple and wave those boards before God. it was a sacred exercise. 

A personal vision board is probably one of the most valuable visualization tools available to you. This powerful tool serves as a tangible image of how you visualize your future - a tangible representation of where you are going. It represents your dreams, your goals, and your ideal life.

Because your mind responds strongly to visual stimulation-Representing your goals with pictures and images will serve to actually strengthen and further stimulate your emotions, and your subconscious regarding  those things which you continually envision and think about. -"As a man thinketh in his heart so is he."

If you have already defined your dreams, it’s time to illustrate them visually.

If you haven't, then you need to be at this session.

Material cost $10.00 Will be collected at session.


Refreshments will be served as always :)

MUST RSVP-No exceptions!!
results.name: "A Clear Vision" Create  a personal vision board with Brittany Jacobs!!

results.description:
The Puffin Foundation works closely with the Nation Institute and one of their acclaimed authors are coming to the Puffin for a lecture and book signing event.


Ari is the author of “Give Us the Ballot: The Modern Struggle for Voting Rights in America.” His book tells the story of the dramatic passage of the Voting Rights Act (VRA) in 1965 and the turbulent forces it unleashed. Berman takes the reader from the demonstrations of the civil rights era to the halls of Congress to the chambers of the Supreme Court. At this important moment in history, Ari Berman sheds new insight into one of the most vital political and civil rights issues of our time. “Give Us the Ballot” has been named best book of 2015 by The Boston Globe and NPR, recognized as a National Book Critics Circle award Finalist for Nonfiction, and NYT Notable Book of 2015.

$10 Suggested Donation

http://www.wnyc.org/story/301405-ari-berman-supreme-courts-voting-rights-ruling

https://www.facebook.com/PuffinCulturalForum

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson with Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes pre-party class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 7 then 'CALL' on the intercom*

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
COME JOIN US AT OUR RETRO NIGHT AS WE TRAVEL THRU PAST DECADES AND BACK TO THE PRESENT IN OUR VERY OWN  MUSICAL TIME MACHINE!

TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DANCING AND ROMANCING AT THIS GREAT VENUE, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN THIS WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE SHOWS THE ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP AND A COUNT FROM ALL THE OTHER 12.

BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9:30 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF FREE PARKING AVAILABLE IN FRONT.

PLEASE USE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE BAR NEXT TO THE DECK.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.name: RETRO NIGHT PARTY @ NORTH STREET TAVERN *MULTI*GROUP*EVENT*­

venue.name: NORTH STREET TAVERN @ The Maple Moor Golf Club

results.description:
COME JOIN US AT OUR RETRO NIGHT AS WE TRAVEL THRU PAST DECADES AND BACK TO THE PRESENT IN OUR VERY OWN  MUSICAL TIME MACHINE!

TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DANCING AND ROMANCING AT THIS GREAT VENUE, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN THIS WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE SHOWS THE ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP AND A COUNT FROM ALL THE OTHER 12.

BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9:30 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF FREE PARKING AVAILABLE IN FRONT.

PLEASE USE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE BAR NEXT TO THE DECK.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

venue.name: 230 Fifth Avenue - Penthouse

results.description:
Note, this is not an African American-only event, but we have a large African American following so you can expect to see lots of African American singles in attendance.


This will be the first weekend of Spring...so start it with a Fling!

Join us for this annual Multi-Meetup event at one of NYC's most exclusive penthouse lounges. 30+ groups co-organizing and we expect to have 300+ attending! Plus we'll have 2 For 1 Drinks, Comp Apps, DJ, Giveaways & More!

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  300+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Price: Only $20 with RSVP/ $30 at the door without RSVP.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have up to 300 members attending.
results.how_to_find_us: We have reserved 230 Fifth Avenue Penthouse exclusively for our event.
results.name: Spring Fling Singles Party (Comp Apps, 2 For 1 Drinks, DJ, Ice Breaker)

venue.address_2: Corner of of Grand & Fulton (Fort Greene)
venue.name: Lox Lounge

results.description: Hey everyone!!! This is a benefit concert where 100% of the proceeds will be donated in order to purchase water filtration systems for the families of Flint, MI. As many of you should know, the water is toxic in Flint, MI and residents have been in need of clean water in order to wash and hydrate themselves. Many residents are sick with infections and other illnesses due to using the toxic water because there was no alternative. This fundraising is assisting in that cause. So come out to support Flint, MI AND hear good music. For more information, visit our Facebook page (Independent Artist Network (IAN)) or go to www.hiphop4flint.com
results.name: HipHop4Flint

results.description:
When moving to a new town, it can be difficult to make new friends. This is especially true of Hoboken and we have new members joining every week. This event is targeted to new members who have not yet made a lot of new friends and want to get out and expand their social circle. All members are welcome to come (old and new). If you don't know anyone, we will start you off by introducing you to other members. You will find that it is a very laid back environment and it is easy to talk to and get to know the other members as everyone is there to meet new people.

You need to get our wrist band to be part of our event. The wrist bands cost $3 per person when you RSVP here or $5 without an RSVP.


Our food and drink specials are:

$4 Drafts
$3 House wine
$3 House mixed drinks
$3 Fireball shots
$5 Jameson shots
$6 Sliders
$5 appetizers
 - Wings
 - Mac and Cheese Bites
 - Mozzarella Sticks
 - Broccoli Cheese Bites
 - House Salad
 - Guacamole and Chips

Note that we have these specials all night long. I will be giving out the wrist bands. You will be able to spot me by looking for the glowing star pendent I will be wearing.

See you there!

-Mike
results.name: New Member Happy Hour

results.description:
Dance your night away to the best Salsa, Bachata, Cha cha, Merengue, and Hustle music Saturday night, March 19th

Free classes at 8pm Party at 9pm!!!

Food and beverages included.

“DANCE FIRST. THINK LATER. IT'S THE NATURAL ORDER .”

Meetup members $10.00 at the door for the party!!!

Check out what you are missing!!!
results.name: SALSA LATIN HUSTLE PARTY - FREE CLASSES - SAT. MARCH 19TH

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave

venue.name: NORTH STREET TAVERN @ The Maple Moor Golf Club

results.description:
COME JOIN US AT OUR RETRO NIGHT AS WE TRAVEL THRU PAST DECADES AND BACK TO THE PRESENT IN OUR VERY OWN  MUSICAL TIME MACHINE!

TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DANCING AND ROMANCING AT THIS GREAT VENUE, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN THIS WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE SHOWS THE ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP AND A COUNT FROM ALL THE OTHER 12.

BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9:30 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF FREE PARKING AVAILABLE IN FRONT.

PLEASE USE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE BAR NEXT TO THE DECK.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE AND TRY TO HAVE EXACT CHANGE AT THE DOOR, THANK YOU!

results.description:
Come Join Us At The Newly Renovated PRIMETIME LOUNGE & RESTAURANT!

This venue is in the heart of the Meadowlands with a cozy lounge room filled with a fireplace, lit up tables, tvs, and a huge bar to order drinks and food.

We'll have a reserved area for members to mingle at.

DJ Music Scheduled To Start At About 10pm. Expect To Hear A Nice Club Mix Of Top 40, Classics, & More.

results.description:
Join millions around the world for Earth Hour: Saturday, March 19th @ 8:30pm by turning off nonessential electrical lights.


https://www.earthhour.org/about-us

"LIGHTS OUT! At 8:30pm on Saturday, March19th, people all over the world are "turning off the lights" to highlight climate change. What will you do to highlight the developed world's use of energy?

Earth Hour was started by WWF in Australia as a local event, but was soon embraced by the rest of the world. Last year 172 countries and territories united to show their commitment to the planet. http://www.earthhour.org/official-videos


Let's celebrate our own commitment to the planet by being part of Earth Hour 2016!
results.name: Let's Turn off the lights for Earth Hour!

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition... RSVP NOW! Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS

9:00 PM- 10:00 PM (1 hour Group Drill for BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE) COST $25 p.p.; 10:00 PM - 11:00 PM (followed by 1 hour match play) $15:  Total Cost $40

(HIGH INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED) Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players, balls, water & light food.

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories)

Please note there is very limited space available...   

MUST RSVP NOW and specify Group drill & match play OR Match Play Only.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT 8:45 PM.

Please note that NY Social Tennis is here to provide fun & competition, please feel free to contact us with your thoughts, concerns, or preference. 

What to Expect... (Warm-up, hitting/drill before placement into levels to play; please feel free to specify if you have a preference... (singles, doubles, mixed).  We will do our best to accommodate!

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis... LET'S HAVE SOME FUN & COMPETITION!

Thanks,

Lily :)

RSVP...

http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/229557671/

UPDATE: Game on!  The field space has been reserved.  Final costs are TBD and will depend on how many people decide to play.  Ryan, JG, and Evan will have more details on that.  Evan and I (Joe) will be taking attendance at Pier40 shortly after 9 pm.  Try to show up on time or a little early so that we can get in a much game time as possible.

-----------------------------

Looking to get some type of league started for men's lacrosse Friday night's at Pier 40 in NYC. 

We'd need some type of guaranteed roster first since we would need a permit and we'll've to charge a small fee depending on how many players we get to pay for the permit (I believe the permit is only $100 per session). 

Looking to set this up weekly especially for those who work in the city and want something to do after work. Let me know!

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with free donuts for the early birds!) and join our volunteer team for New York Cares Spring Day (April 18th).

On March 19th we will be having a special event in partnership with New York Cares. Come meet and watch several of the city's biggest names in comedy, then sign up for "Team Clean Comics" and join us as we crack some jokes and get in on some spring cleaning!

This is a wonderful opportunity to meet some amazing comics, drink some stiff beverages and get organized to help our city!

Signups at bit.ly/teamcleancomics 

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"
results.name: Watch Comedy, Eat Donuts, Help NYC

results.description:
Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free before midnight. Doorman's discretion afterwards. (Mention Rory's List to the door person)


There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Please get there early to avoid the long lines.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
BACHATA Night!

DJs: Brian "EL MATATAN", Young Maestra and Milton "EL TOLETE"

@ 10: 30pm Milton "EL TOLETE" teaching the basics and Logistics of BACHATA.

                                       **This is BYOB Studio**

• Complimentary Drink and Snacks

What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

Have a Birthday Coming up! Contact us to do your Bday Party.


More information: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/663744417058409/

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


We’ve got a very special Quiet Clubbing Bash, going down at the Inwood Bar And Grill! As you already know, our parties have been getting bigger and better with each new venue, so we are very excited for this special kick-off to get underway for this new spot. We’re expecting this to be a great one.

There Will Be 3 Dj’s Spinning Live!
Green: Top 40 Dance Hits
Red: 80’s/90’s/EDM Mashups
Blue: Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Quiet Clubbing Takes Over Uptown!

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans, 

Now that pre-season testing is over, it's time to get ready for the first race of the season, the 2016 Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne.  Hosting for the 21st consecutive year, the Albert Park temporary circuit provides a stern challenge for drivers and cars alike.  The 3.3 mile track with its 16 corners features a combination of short straights and second and third gear chicanes.

As ever in Formula One, the new season brings with it a host of new regulations with the important changes around exhaust layout, new tire compound and new qualifying format with "live" elimination.  For details:  http://www.formula1.com/content/fom-website/en/championship/inside-f1/rules-regs/2016_season_changes.html

Also, this year marks the longest season in F1 history with 21 races as the German and European GP (first time in Baku, Azerbaijan) returns to the calendar. This season will also feature 22 cars on the grid once again with the addition of the American Haas F1 Team.

TIRE ALLOCATION - As per new regulations, Pirelli is allocating three dry weather compounds: P Zero white medium, yellow soft and red supersoft tires (first time at Albert Park).  As usual the teams will be required to use two compounds during the race.

So will Mercedes continue their domination of the V6 turbo era and win the first race of the year?  Or will Ferrari carry over their strong pre-season form with a victory?  Or can Williams surprise the paddock by winning?  If you're in the New York City area and looking for great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Australian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag.  Race will start at 1:00AM ET with the pre-race starting at 12:00AM ET.

Stay up late on a Saturday night and join us for another exciting start to the season!  We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2016 Australian Grand Prix

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
ATTENTION! ATTENTION! ATTENTION!

Due to recent complications at white plains high school, we will be using a different venue until further notice!

This new field is turf so please bring turf shoes if possible.

Bring a white shirt and colored shirt to help with forming teams easily.

We're getting a lot more active players in our group, which is great, but that means we're also getting a LOT of people at the pick up games. To avoid having too many, I've set a limit at 28 people, leaving room for a few subs on each team.

results.description:
We are moving to Calvert Vaux for this week. It's getting more busy as the weather gets warmer and there are more leagues. We're also trying to let the Dyker field's grass grow a bit and not make it into a muddy mess.

We'll try to play a game on the artificial soccer field at Calvert and then move to the slightly sloped softball field we played at last year also at Calvert if we get pushed out. I might be late but Eric will have the field set up and teams organized. 

Thank you.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Recall and Refresh your SCUBA Skills

RSVP required


Has it been a while since you have been diving? Have 12 months gone by and you are planning a big trip? Do you want the reassurance that you are doing everything properly? Lets try to retrieve the data necessary data. The "Total Recall"/Inactive Diver Program will get you back up to speed. During the course, your Instructor will review equipment assembly and maintenance, dive planning, hand signals, proper ascents and descents, emergency procedures, and buoyancy. By the end of this course you will be able to enjoy your next big dive with confidence and ease.

Cost: Depends on what gear you need,

Premium members $25 or free with annual subsription coupon

$49 Includes Tanks & Weights.

$59 Includes; BCD, Regulator, Instruments, Tanks and Weights.

results.name: SCUBA Refresher aka Total Recall

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.

Join us for this, the third part of the September 11th National Memorial Trail Series hike, which will be a loop also utilizing the Morris Canal historic route as closely as we can!

We will begin by following the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway to where we left off on the previous hike....


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/261764_10150241102501777_533661_n.jpg?oh=18a3c26f1c9c9581b85e6ff5650f013a&oe=57221D78

There is a little bit of a street section we need to walk for this section at first, but it's always interesting walking through these areas!


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/262174_10150241102521777_4033525_n.jpg?oh=9b6f6f48434dc7d4d1ea7ab87a9aabb9&oe=570DF9EE

The section offers unparalleled views of the NY City Skyline along the waterfront, and has some very nice memorials along the way.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/268949_10150241101451777_5569305_n.jpg?oh=a47d56750979c7e02a1a35742853ad66&oe=57100015

For this reason, It is appropriate that we use this section of the waterfront for this hike.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlf1/v/t1.0-9/269729_10150241101331777_2730787_n.jpg?oh=ee58e160b1c9dfd17d03905e999e00b6&oe=570AE91D

We'll hike the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway to the Hoboken Terminal where we had left off on the previous hike in the series, actually heading east rather than west on the 911 Trail route to make easier connection, then turn west and follow the route where it is superimposed onto the East Coast Greenway Route. An interactive map of the route can be found here:
http://www.libertygap.org/
The trail follows Thomas Gangemi St, 6th St, Newark Ave, Pavonia Ave, Baldwin Ave, and Belmont Ave to Lincoln Park.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/10407911_902425883127284_6090412904012339376_n.jpg?oh=4de8797274c16754d956a4df99e3360b&oe=576AE72F

We will follow the LWG Trail route to the Truck Rt 1 & 9 bridge, but that section will be part of our hike in April (pending my work schedule not messing it up).
From here, we begin our loop by tracing the route of the historic Morris Canal.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/10462881_902427036460502_263119052606425082_n.jpg?oh=4b616fa93497e04a5d5af7c2be4bc096&oe=572A4F27

It's rather surprising that so much of it has been left untouched in Jersey City. We'll walk a rather nice greenway for much of the time.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlp1/v/l/t1.0-9/1607121_902427233127149_1495268587622476484_n.jpg?oh=b14991f5b6fedf91da413e2f3bbdd952&oe=57367092

The first bit will involve road walking the highway south, because it has obliterated the former canal route, but when it turns away, it is grassy and one might think they're farther west.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/11221572_902427423127130_8970017235155515721_n.jpg?oh=09ae07423cfb4b4fd9fa30767e390332&oe=57335BFB

More evidence of the canal will be seen as we continue, whether it's the intact prism or towpath remnant, but we still have to walk some roads.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtf1/v/t1.0-9/11254348_902428356460370_6358952714299100289_n.jpg?oh=61e991923bba79364de5b6af9da6585b&oe=576B25B8

Overall, the route is easy to follow toward the border of Bayonne, however we present here a bit of our guide to the canal that applies to this particular hike.  It covers from the Truck Rt 1 and 9 bridge to the eastern terminus.
108.95 Reach Rt 440 in Jersey City. Continue south on the right side. Jersey City has a greenway plan for the Morris Canal with a map that can be viewed here: http://morriscanaljc.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/techmemo2_revised_10-18-12.pdf
109.00 Just past where Clendenny Ave turns left away from Rt 440 on the opposite side is about where the Morris Canal came out to run parallel or on what is now Rt 440. Continue south on 440, the former canal route. Pass retail buildings and a jughandle.
109.15 Just after the jughandle, cross Rt 440 on a crosswalk directly over both north and southbound lanes. Turn right, continuing south parallel with Rt 440. Pass more industry and retail.
109.30 Shortly after crossing Clark Ave, and passing a building near to the road on the left, a large parking area which is almost like a side road follows Rt 440 on the left. This may have been the route of the Morris Canal, or a prior main road route next to the canal. Follow it south near to 440.
Pass Water Street and through more parking areas keeping to the left of 440.
109.52 Cross Culver Ave continuing south.
109.65 Large open parking ara on the left. Continue parallel with 440.
109.80 Cross entrance to a large box store and continue on a nice newer sidewalk.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlf1/v/t1.0-9/10469201_902428849793654_1854735185208929438_n.jpg?oh=33d35bae329997a6febcc377b1eb6355&oe=573BAA55

109.95 Another box store entrance. Continue south and soon return to a sidewalk closer to Rt 440. Large building to the left, followed by car and truck lots.
110.26 Reach the diagonal intersection with Danforth Ave. Continue to cross the crosswalk over Danforth. At the intersection, walk behind a small eatery with Danforth Avenue slowly moving off to the left, while Rt 440 is slowly moving off to the right. The former Morris Canal route passes directly behind the eatery. Head in a straight line to the end of the pavement.
110.36 Reach the end of the pavement. The former canal is recognizable and easily walkable as an undeveloped strip between retail and residential areas. Soon, Sullivan Drive parallels the greenway. Follow the former canal trail south.
110.55 A line of parking spots is along Sullivan Drive to the left, parallel with the canal route. Continue along the former canal on the grass.
110.65 Reach and cross Batholdi Ave along the old canal route. Continue on the greenway between houses heading south.
110.75 Cross Mina Drive on the former canal route, after shortly pralleling Sayles Street. Pass between more homes in a very pleasantly surprising section of canal greenway. It is wonderful that such a nice section of the canal greenway has been preserved in Jersey City.
110.92 Cross a sidewalk which leads left to Gates Avenue or right to Sycamore Road. The canal greenway can be followed a short distance ahead, but when scouted, it led to a chain link fence that was extremely difficult to get over, and required backtracking anyway. Hikers should turn right on the sidewalk to Sycamore Road and turn left, parallel with the park (name of park???).
111.08 Reach the end of the park along Sycamore Road. Continue on the road ahead through residential area.
111.15 Reach West 63rd Street and turn left.
111.20 Eatery on the left, the canal passed directly behind it, partially through the parking lot. Continue ahead along the road.
111.30 Reach John F. Kennedy Blvd. Turn around, and look at the parking lot behind. It is apparent where the canal was up to this point. Perhaps in the near future this will be a continueous route. Cross over JFK on the crosswalk, and continue on Morris Canal trail sidewalk. The canal route is a fenced in greenway to the right, and is quite nice, parallel with city park (name???).
111.39 Reach Ruby Brown Terrace and turn right. The canal greenway continues next to the sidewalk along the road to the right.
111.44 Parking area on the right, built on the former canal.
111.48 At the intersection to Merrit Street, look straight ahead. The Morris Canal continued under the railroad tracks here, and the bridge is still in place. Unfortunately, it is badly overgrown, and beyond there is no good way under Rt 78. Turn left and follow Merrit Street.
111.62 Turn left from Merrit Street onto Avenue Cut and pass beneath the railroad tracks and Rt 78.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtf1/v/t1.0-9/11070553_902429966460209_6680502407107871787_n.jpg?oh=eab5fa6c155f288a8dd63e4ebff99d68&oe=576CDB91

111.75 After reaching the south side of the Rt 78 underpass, note the gated former canal on the right, parallel with the highway. The canal route continues ahead to the left across a wide parking lot. Turn left to cross Avenue C and follow the canal route across the parking lot. A building is built over the historic route ahead, but pass around it to the right, then turn slightly left again to come to the intersectin of Broadway and 55th Street.
11.95 Intersection of Broadway and 55th Street. Carefully cross Broadway, then diagonally follow the canal route which is the right side of a parking lot continuing generally in the direction it has been travelling to the southeast.
112.07 After passing slightly to the right of a large box store, come to a small field of short pieces of utility poles. These exist at several locations for the purpose of testing different woods for these poles.
This unfortunately is the farthest south one can reasonably walk along the canal route. The canal made this sweeping south to north turn in order to negotiate the lower end of Bergen Hill, the southern terminus of the igneus intrusive basalt formation of the Palisades. The northern terminus is in NY wester of Haverstraw where the formation once again dips beneath the surface of the Earth. Turn around and head back to Garfield Ave at the start of the parking area, and turn right to pass beneath Rt 78 again.
For those who do not wish to do the long road walk, it is possible to hike south a bit further to the corner of Center Street and Avenue E to take a light rail train on or near the old canal route to the north and skip the following section. The station has Morris Canal signage stating the canal passed "near" here.
112.50 After passing beneath the railroad overpass, reach Catherine Court and cross it. This route can be followed to Princeton Ave, then to Cator Ave to be closer to the former canal route, but there are no remnants to see. It is better to remain on Garfield.
113.07 Pass Cator Ave on the right. There is a cemetery a block down Cater, off of Princeton Ave which has at times been open, and is very nice to walk through. It more closely parallels the railroad tracks and therefore the canal route as well, however cemeteries in urbanized areas such as this one tend to be locked at all but one entrance more often than not. It is likely that it will be necessary to remain on Garfield Ave northeast.
113.12 Willard Street enters the cemetery on the right. The expansive cemetery occupies both sides of the road making for a much nicer walking experience for some time.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/1977114_902431603126712_3341558900992828982_n.jpg?oh=b15c60fbaec9defce46d0e3b1a0583dc&oe=576ECC7B

113.47 Reach a park entrance road and parallel path to the right. Turn here, cross the entrance road on a path, and continue to the right parallel with the entrance road. Soon, cross the road once more and continue east northeast through the park on one of two parallel concrete pathways with intersection pathways between them. The canal was just off to the right beyond the railroad tracks on the south side of the park.
113.71 The paths converge and reach Richard Street. Turn left and head back out to Garfield Ave, then turn right to continue on Garfield once more.
114.0 Bayview Ave is on the right. A short walk down Bayview will lead to a swath of woods and trees over which a bridge crosses. This is the former canal route, though it is inaccessible at this point. Continue on Garfield.
114.31 Cross Caven Point Road and continue on Garfield. A block down Caven Point, at the intersection with Halladay Street, the canal crossed. There are very little remnants to see if any.
114.50 Carteret Ave on the right. The canal crossed this road as well. Some of the historic route makes up access roads through the industrial sites, but they are inaccessible to pedestrians at this time.
114.65 Pass beneath railroad tracks on Carteret (rail history???)
115.0 Reach the intersection with Communipaw Ave. There are possible opportunities for better re-routes in the near future on this section with the availability of the historic canal route due to intelligent development. We will try to update this guide as the better routes become available.
Turn right on Communipaw. The canal crossed at the intersection with Berry Lane on the right. Continue on Communipaw.
115.14 Turn left on Manning Ave
115.22 Reach the intersection with Lafayette Street. Cross diagonally to the right a bit, and continue along the north side of a park (park name???)
A development to the left bears the name "Canal Circle". The canal passed through the north side of the small community.
115.31 Reach Maple Street and turn right, remaining on the park path.
115.40 Reach Van Horne Street and turn left. Follow the road out and across Johnson Ave to where there is a vacant lot to the left.
115.53 Turn right on Carbon Street, which follows the historic route of the canal.
115.60 Reach and cross Halladay Street on an angle. Turn left slightly, then right onto a concrete path between buildings on the historic canal route.
115.68 Reach Pacific Ave in front of a through style truss railroad bridge. Note the width of the bridge is enough for both road and former canal to pass beneath. Turn left on Pacific Ave and pass beneath Rt 78. The canal headed due east, but is inaccessible here.
115.84 Reach Grand Street and turn right, across Pacific Ave eastbound.
115.97 Reach and turn right on Monmouth Street and parallel a sub station (electric) to the right.
116.04 After crossing an entrance road with a median on the left, cross a parking lot ahead. Enter the parking lot, not the parallel road to the right, and follow the lot to the south end. The south side of the lot is the former canal. Turn left at the end of the lot. The road exiting is called Canal Street.
116.20 Reach Varick Street, a parallel road next to Jersey Avenue. From here, two alternatives diverge. To the right, the Liberty-Water Gap Trail route leads down Jersey Ave to a foot bridge over the west end of the Morris Canal Big Basin (note that the foot bridge was destroyed during Tropical Storm Sandy in 2012 and may be closed for some time). Hikers can then follow paths parallel to Audrey Zapp Drive out to the Central Railroad of NJ terminal on the south side of the Morris Canal Big Basin, a little over a mile beyond depending on which route is taken.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11391550_902432753126597_2504165647734956113_n.jpg?oh=07d9d92b76bf05ca71895e62173ce2e0&oe=57292AED

This guide will follow the main historic canal route as closely as possible.
Cross Jersey Avenue on a cross walk and pass the Jersey City Light Rail station on the right. Continue ahead through th eparking area and along Regent Street.
116.42 At the end of Regent Street, turn right on Tidewater Street. Go one block, then turn left closely parallel with the light rail tracks.
116.60 Reach Marin Blvd. Turn right briefly, then cross on a crosswalk, and follow along south side of the light rail tracks. If there is not an open greenway here on the south side of the tracks, continue to the nearest block and head east to Van Vorst Street, south to the railroad crossing. From Van Vorst Street, head to the north side of the light rail tracks and follow Essex Street east, still parallel with the tracks. It is also possible to head south to Dudley Street and head east. Either way, hikers will need to head one block south to Dudley Street at their discretion, OR head south on Van Vorst to the Waterfront Walkway along the north side of Morris Canal Big Basin.
116.96 Morris Canal Little Basin is at the intersection of Dudley Street and ????????????????. Turn right, then left into into the park on paved path. This was also the site of Lock #22 East, the final lock of the Morris Canal.
117.15 Reach the end of the Peninsula of the Morris Canal Park, where the Morris Canal Big Basin joins the Morris Canal Little Basin. The original Morris Canal was only 102 miles, but the detours necessary to follow the historic route today add significantly to the distance of the canal.
From Dudley Street, hikers may also turn left, then right heading east on Essex Street to reach Colgate Park and the Colgate Clock built in 1924, which sits closer to the mouth of the Morris Canal on the Hudson, just over a quarter mile further, near Exchange Place below the Goldman Sachs Tower, the largest skyscraper in Jersey City.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11209478_902433546459851_208719393855600385_n.jpg?oh=42dbbf91bbda219a6437060e47f95967&oe=57362CFC


When we reach the Liberty State Park, and the eastern terminus of the canal, we can turn back to the Liberty State Park light rail again to finish the day. 

Note that there are several other places where public transportation are available on this hike, and toward the end we pass close to other light rail stops making early outs more possible.
If anyone has further questions or concerns, reach out to me at[masked]
-M'ke
results.how_to_find_us: Simply park at the station and together we will take the light rail north to Hoboken Terminal area.
results.name: 911 Memorial Trail Pt. 3 & Morris Canal Pt 1: Hoboken, Jersey City, & Bayonne!

group.name: Metrotrails: NJ, PA, NY Metropolitan Area Hiking and More!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
