results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos
results.name: Flag Football Game - Sunday @ 9:00 am!

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details:
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

- - - - - -  
Please see our full calendar of events 
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+ 
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/
- - - - - -
results.name: Mid-Packers LSD Run (10–16 Miles)

results.description:
Приглашаем пройти живописный маршрут

Маршрут проходит по части Appalachian Trail и одному из самых красивых видов NJ "Stairway to Heaven"
Протяженность 7.5 миль.

Необходимы мин. 2 машины 

...


Hike boardwalks, a suspension bridge, hardwood forest, fields of wildflowers, train tracks, a cow pasture, a boulder field… before steeply climbing the “Stairway to Heaven” to one of the best viewpoints in NJ: Pinwheel Vista! This 7 1/2 mile hike is a NJ favorite. It will take approximately 4 hours and has an ascent of 1180 ft.

You need:

- Hiking Boots
 - Water
 - Mickrospikes 

---------------
Start: Appalachian Trail Parking - Pochuck
Route 517 & Carol Drive, Glenwood, NJ

893 County Road 517

Glenwood, NJ 07418

GPS:[masked], [masked]

End:

Parker Lake

[masked], [masked]

this is our meeting spot.


Место встречи  выглядит вот так!

-----------------------------

Map: North Jersey Trails


------------------------------------

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation

that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please, review safety information 

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/
results.name: Stairway to Heaven / Pinwheel Vista

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

ADMISSION PRICE: $10. Pay directly to Nick at the event.

DESCRIPTION:


Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  8 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

WEAR:
Sport cloth and sneaker.

BRING:
Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.
PS.If you don't have a badminton racquet, you can rent one at the center for $4 per day and $20 deposit.

LOCATION:
New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below. 


TRANSPORTATION:
Subway: #7 train to Main St. Station, 10-13 min walk.



REFERENCE LINK:

• http://newyorkbadmintoncenter.com/

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

END

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

This three hours is dedicated to practice as taught by Reggie Ray in the lineage of Chogyam Trungpa Rinpoche. We will do guided body work, sitting meditation and walking meditation. Sometimes there is a brief dharma talk followed by questions and discussion. The first hour of practice is dedicated to beginners, so if three hours is daunting, you may come for the first hour and leave after that. All are welcome!

Practice is lead by senior teachers Tina LaGreca and occasional visiting teachers. For more information about our teachers see the  "About Us" section.

We have a suggested donation of $10 to $20 to support the space and the teachings. No one will ever be turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
We will also pick up riders at 1st Avenue at 110th St at 10:30AM!  Let me know which starting point you want.

Looking for strong riders, road bikes, now for this ride, put yourself on the waiting list first and then if there is room I'll add you! We'll head up to Greenwich CT where we will stop for food and drink. From the Manhattan side of the Bridge that's 32 miles.  From 110th St it's 26 miles.  Time for a fuel break and a nice casual lunch at that point!

The second part begins after refueling and a beer or two.  We head up the coast of Connecticut and we have a lot of options here for how long and how often to stop!  We will stop for a lot of views along the way.  I would say the most we would do is another 45,  but we can easily chop off miles if we feel like stopping for more beers before the ride back to the city.  Train stations every few miles as we head up along this route!

https://goo.gl/6vTdJF

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree

Hi! I'm Aishling, a recently certified PiYo instructor. PiYo is a fun and dynamic blend of Pilates and Yoga. It combines the muscle-sculpting, core-firming benefits of Pilates with the strength and flexibility advantages of yoga. And, I crank up the speed to deliver a true fat-burning, low-impact workout that leaves your body looking long, lean, and incredibly defined.

I teach classes at On Your Toes Dance Studio on McLean Ave in Yonkers every Sunday morning at 10am and I would love to have you join me. Classes are usually $10 pay as you go but I am offering your first class for free! Feel free to bring a friend too. Don't worry if you can't make it this week. I am there every Sunday! Feel free to reach out to me at [masked] or call/text me on (914)[masked] if you have any questions or if you want to chat.

Hope to see you there!

WELCOME SPRING! 

IT IS SPRING!  YES?!  Come nourish and watch your new year seedling/wish grow with yummy energizing practice each week! While the air is warming and the earth is becoming fertile with rain, it's a perfect opportunity to stretch out and try out new patterns, create, and manifest 2016! What will it be like?  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.

results.description:
Platform program with Rev. Barbara Simpson, member of the New York Society for Ethical Culture, Humanist minister and a Doctor of Ministry.

What is a Death Café? The idea of a Café Mortel (or "Death Café") comes from the work of Swiss sociologist Bernard Crettaz. At a Death Cafe people drink tea, eat cake and discuss death. The aim is to increase awareness of death to help people make the most of their (finite) lives. Today, Death Café's are held in over 33 countries.

Barbara leads a Death Café on the second Sunday of every month at the New York Society for Ethical Culture.
results.name: Welcome to the Death Café

results.description:
Please join us for today’s service led by Rev. Paul Dodenhoff. “Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think,” said the Buddha. Thoughts have power. But do they actually create our reality? Today we’ll think about what the Buddha and others have taught about the power of thought and just what that means – and doesn’t mean – in our daily lives.

Bring a friend and stay for coffee and light refreshments. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: Thinking About Thinking

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour brunch party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 103 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Following the tour ( approx. 90 minutes )you are welcome to join the group at our Sunday Brunch Party at The St. Pat's Tavern.

Meet at The Pershing Square Cafe at 11:am

What to wear: Dress for the weather but you will only be outside for 15 minutes of the tour.

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

What to expect: 15-20 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

results.description:
Quietly, peacefully mend and meld mind and spirit as prescribed by the  Master Messengers throughout the Ages —  Jesus, Siddhārtha Gautama, Mohammad, Confucius, Handsome Lake, Lao Tzu, White Buffalo Calf Woman, The Peacemaker, Zoroaster, Mahavira, Mani, to name a few.

We do not defend, or offend, any particular religion or belief system, or anthropomorphize any deity.  

Instead, we aim to personify the Mind-Spirit connection through the words of the Masters, and make it our way of life in order to:

  • Build and maintain excellent character, as is our birthright.

  • Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

  • Clarify and awaken the God within as both a journey and a destination.

  • Reunite the positive (Spirit) with the powerful (Mind) in us all to actualize our awesome potential.

That's the goal of our 11:00 a.m. Sunday Gathering.  (See below for location.)


At 12:00 p.m., leave refreshed, renewed, and re-energized, and in control of what comes next.

Speaking of what comes next, we sometimes commune afterward  by way of food, drink, and conversation.  It would be great if you joined us!

Consider it.

We look forward to your company. 


Respectfully,


Rev. Alexander

results.description:
We will be reading Moloka'i, by Alan Brennert.

This richly imagined novel, set in Hawai'i more than a century ago, is an extraordinary epic of a little-known time and place---and a deeply moving testament to the resiliency of the human spirit.

Rachel Kalama, a spirited seven-year-old Hawaiian girl, dreams of visiting far-off lands like her father, a merchant seaman. Then one day a rose-colored mark appears on her skin, and those dreams are stolen from her. Taken from her home and family, Rachel is sent to Kalaupapa, the quarantined leprosy settlement on the island of Moloka'i. Here her life is supposed to end---but instead she discovers it is only just beginning.

With a vibrant cast of vividly realized characters, Moloka'i is the true-to-life chronicle of a people who embraced life in the face of death. Such is the warmth, humor, and compassion of this novel that "few readers will remain unchanged by Rachel's story"

results.description: The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.
results.name: Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
SIGN UP HERE


Event Description


Dorie Hagler will be moderating a panel discussion about the role that women’s photographs play in changing societal perceptions. The panel will include a street photographer, war photographer, fashion photographer, fine art photographer, photojournalist and photo editor. Come and be inspired. Come with questions. Come with your camera and your friends.

Panelists:


                                                   Joanne Dugan


Joanne Dugan is a New York City-based photographer and author. Her studio's diverse award-winning projects include published books, commissioned photography shoots, short films and limited-edition prints.

Joanne’s work has been published in seven books that combine photographs and text, including the best selling Taxi Driver Wisdom, (Chronicle Books), ABC NYC: A Book About Seeing New York City (Abrams) and two fine-art monographs. She was recently the editor for the hardcover photography book Summertime, published by Chronicle Books, featuring the work of 46 notable and emerging photographers from around the world.

                                                    Andrea Wise

Andrea Wise leads teams creating multi-platform visual storytelling experiences. As Lead Photo Editor at ViewFind, an early-stage visual storytelling startup aimed at bringing visual stories to a mass audience while innovating new models for photojournalists to monetize their work, her role is constantly shifting and evolving. Prior to joining ViewFind, Andrea was Project Director for "Family. Life.", a global collaborative student project recapturing Edward Steichen's "The Family of Man" sponsored by The Alexia Foundation, PhotoShelter, PDN, ASMP, and Photo Wings. 

                                                 Amy Arbus


Photographer Amy Arbus has published five books, including the award winning On the Street[masked] and The Inconvenience of Being Born. The New Yorker called The Fourth Wall her masterpiece. Her most recent, After Images, is an homage to modernism's most iconic avant-garde paintings.

Her advertising clients include Chiat/Day, Foote, Cone and Belding, American Express, Saatchi & Saatchi, SpotCo, New Line Cinema and Nickelodeon. Her photographs have appeared in over one hundred periodicals around the world, including New York Magazine,People, Aperture and The New York Times Magazine.


                                                       Lauren Welles

                                             Radhika Chalasani

Radhika is Senior Photo Editor CBS News Digital.

Moderator:

                                                  Dorie Hagler


Dorie Hagler is a storyteller and an advocate. She advocates for people, communities, and businesses by telling their stories in a compelling, honest and humanizing way. Dorie is inspired by the stories regardless of whether they are news breaking international natural disasters or her hometown's rodeo queen competition.


Dorie's photographs appear in distinguished publications such as The New York Times, Sports Illustrated, The Chicago Tribune, The Denver Post, The Albuquerque Journal, The Taos News, Ski Magazine, New Mexico Magazine, Mothering Magazine and many others.
results.name: Women Photographers: A Panel Discussion

results.description:
Facilitated by Jennifer Scarlott and Mary Hemings, Bronx Climate Justice North


How does living in the era of climate change affect you emotionally and psychologically? Come share your thoughts, feelings, and experiences. We will learn about such concepts as eco-psychology, biophilia, “psychic numbing,” and resilience in the time of climate change. How can we empower ourselves, as individuals and as communities, to face the problems we confront, and create solutions with a sense of hope, joy, and resilience? What is the interplay between personal and community resilience and climate justice? Hint: There is safety, and action, in numbers!

In preparation for this platform, you may wish to read one or more of these articles from our website. 

This event will include a short video, reflection, and interactive discussion on the theme and topics mentioned above. Please join us!
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Seeking Resilience in the Fight Against Climate Change

results.description:
Well, it's not just speculation anymore. Several state primaries have now taken place. In most years, the contest between Clinton and Sanders would be considered intense, but it's paled compared to the Republican side. How is this all going to shake out? Have the latest results changed anyone's minds? Are we seeing permanent splits developing in both parties?

The FBI wants Apple to weaken the security of iPhones, but Apple has said no. For the first time in many years, a large American company is pushing back very hard and very publicly against government monitoring. Is the FBI's request justifiable? Is Apple being paranoid? Is there room for compromise?

The Supreme Court recently lost its most powerful conservative voice, Antonin Scalia. With Obama in the White House, this is the first chance to establish a left-leaning Supreme Court in over a generation. However, most Republicans in the Senate have vowed to not even meet Obama's nominees. Should we wait for the next president to pick the new justice? Or is the Senate majority avoiding its Constitutional duty?

results.name: Primaries, Apple vs. FBI, and the Supreme Court

results.description:
Status

This Improv for Actors workshop will focus on status. Your status fluctuates and is relative to other people and/or your environment.  For example, a man might be high status to his children but low status to his boss. Or high status to his home but low status to the forest.

Awareness of status is an important tool for the actor. It can help create characters, relationships and stories. In this workshop you will learn about high and low status behaviors and, through exercises and scene work, you will learn how to use them when performing.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15* 

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more.
results.name: Status

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME 90 mins SUN 11:45 AM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:
Join DM Evan Lonergan in his first Wildpig D&D Game! Spires of the Embershade is an adventure for six 3rd level characters.

Welcome to the Brotherhood of the Phoenix: the most powerful adventuring guild in all of Aria! You're about to embark on your first job as initiates. A village near the Embershade Mountains has reported goblins attacking and kidnapping their villagers, and has asked the Brotherhood for help. Will your first job with the Brotherhood turn out to be as simple as it seems?
results.name: D&D 5E: Brotherhood of the Phoenix - Spires of the Embershade

results.description:
Set in the wildest decade ever, DISASTER! is the new Broadway musical that delivers earthquakes, tidal waves, infernos and some of the most unforgettable songs of the 70's. 

DISASTER! boasts a truly outrageous cast featuring the Tony®-nominated and Tony®-winning stars of Rent, Rock of Ages, Hairspray, Xanadu, Guys and Dolls and The Producers.

You will also join 30+ other Meetup members at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

Prepay Only Event. Get Tickets Here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/disaster/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (12pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets.  The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, week of show date.  

We'll leave the pre-mingle at 1:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 2pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $69.95 to $89.95 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket) 

*Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/disaster/

*Prepay Only Event. Must purchase ticket in advance to attend.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aEpvRftziE8&list=PLjLKty-MyWCVEpk0I_Z4p6szGPmSCTCik

About the Show

Disaster! is set on a summer night in Manhattan in 1979 and follows a group of NYC A-listers who party at the grand opening of a floating casino/disco—until disaster strikes. Earthquakes, tidal waves, infernos, killer bees, rats, sharks, and piranhas all threaten the guests, who sing some of the biggest hits of the ‘70s including “Hot Stuff,” “I Am Woman,” “Knock on Wood” and more.

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/disaster/

results.description: In Part 2, we'll cover the expansion of powers with the transformation from Octavian to Augustus, the enlargement of the empire under his rule and his enduring policies and accomplishments. We'll also look at some of the key influencers in his life, including Agrippa and Livia.
results.name: Augustus' Rome - his path from 2nd triumvirate to Rome's first emperor Part 2

results.description:
Reminder - 3rd Sunday of the month is Show & Tell. Please bring in a short presentation of your art (5 minutes) in whatever format you can. Thanks!

We are a small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way Show & Tell this week

results.description:
"Top o' the morning  to ya"and other Irish cliches will not abound at our monthly games meetup.  Good games and great people, however, will.  It's just a pleasant way to pass a Sunday afternoon with other fun locals. 

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!

       Whiskey and "Nuns on the Run"--a solid combination

What are we going to play?

It'll be mostly the usual fare of games like Medina,  Nuns on the Run, Avalon, Steam Park, Coup...  These are relatively simple modern board games that have a quick rules explanation and play in less than an hour.

Anything new?

Glad you asked!  I'll definitely have Asteroyds.  We didn't get to play it last time but in Asteryods you have to decide where your space ship needs to go to avoid all this space stuff.  Except the asteroids are moving.  And you have a matter of seconds to figure it out!  

If you're really curious about what I might bring, probe the nerdy depths of my collection and visit my Board Game Geek page.  The bar does have a nice copy of Catan on hand as well. 

What, no Sorry or Pictionary?

This particular meetup focuses on new board games (post-Settlers of Catan, 1994).  I know a lot of people like the old classics like Trouble, Uno, Monopoly and Taboo but in my humble opinion, new games are designed better, are more fun, easy to learn and play much quicker than your childhood classics.  If you come with an open mind willing to try something new, I think you'll really like the new kids on the block.  I should add, I will flat out refuse to play Cards Against Humanity.  I love edgy, provocative comedy but these guys put into words my feelings on the game better than I could do here.  Sorry to be a downer.

                   Who says "Hare and Tortoise" is a game for kids?


But I'm barely getting out of bed when this is starting!

I know that noon on a Sunday is a bit early for people--I get it, believe me--but as long as you show up by 4 (or even 5) you should be able to get some gaming in.

Food and Drink

Skylark is a great bar in Park Slope in its own right.  They have some good bar food but are also open to outside food as long as we clean up.  They have been tremendous hosts so have a drink, a little nosh and tip well!  

Contact

My phone number is listed near the top of this posting if you have any questions day-of.  And with that we'll see you there!  Or else...

                      Point guns at each other in Ca$h 'n Gun$


         (This picture refuses to stay rotated.  Still kinda works though)
results.name: Board Gameday--St. Patrick's Day Edition

group.name: New York City Geek Adventure Group

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...
results.how_to_find_us: Look for flying discs...
results.name: Sunday Ultimate @ 12PM, Riverside Park

results.description: This is the very first brunch at Gin Fizz Harlem. I came up with the logistics with the owner and we created Lush Life. $40 Buffet Brunch but it's unlimited drinks with no time limit for the duration of brunch. That's right! It's all you can drink from 1-4pm. I hope you can recover in time for work on Monday. As usual, I will make sure the food is up to par and the cocktails pack a punch. The bottomless brunch is from 1-4pm The brunch party goes from 12-6pm. I look forward to seeing everyone there . I will have an area reserved for the Meetup but if you wish to sit with us I am only reserving seats until 2pm.
results.name: Enjoy the Lush Life

results.description:
Please join us for March 2016's discussion of "Between the World and Me" by Ta-Nehisi Coates. Please come with a spirit of fellowship, a point of view, and an open mind.

I can't wait to see you there!

Christina

***Book Synopsis***

In a profound work that pivots from the biggest questions about American history and ideals to the most intimate concerns of a father for his son, Ta-Nehisi Coates offers a powerful new framework for understanding our nation’s history and current crisis. Americans have built an empire on the idea of “race,” a falsehood that damages us all but falls most heavily on the bodies of black women and men—bodies exploited through slavery and segregation, and, today, threatened, locked up, and murdered out of all proportion. What is it like to inhabit a black body and find a way to live within it? And how can we all honestly reckon with this fraught history and free ourselves from its burden?

Between the World and Me is Ta-Nehisi Coates’s attempt to answer these questions in a letter to his adolescent son. Coates shares with his son—and readers—the story of his awakening to the truth about his place in the world through a series of revelatory experiences, from Howard University to Civil War battlefields, from the South Side of Chicago to Paris, from his childhood home to the living rooms of mothers whose children’s lives were taken as American plunder. Beautifully woven from personal narrative, reimagined history, and fresh, emotionally charged reportage, Between the World and Me clearly illuminates the past, bracingly confronts our present, and offers a transcendent vision for a way forward.

***Where to Find the Book***

Amazon

Barnes & Noble

Brooklyn Public Library

Hue-Man Bookstore

New York Public Library

Newark Public Library

Queens Public Library

Sisters Uptown Bookstore

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, March 19th for 2 hrs of community, networking, learning & a lively discussion about marketing basics for holistic women in business.

BUY TICKETS NOW

Knowing how to write & talk about what you do is surprisingly challenging for entrepreneurs, especially for holistic women who offer services that help so many different areas of life & business. Many of us work with energy or talk about health & wellness for the body, mind & spirit - which can either sound a little esoteric to the masses or just sounds like what everyone else is offering. Yikes! How then, do you stand out and let them know that what you have to offer is unique? And how do you do that in a way that is fast, clear, concise & not boring. If you have trouble explaining what you do & what they get - how can you expect them to invest in your services?

Marketing you services becomes so much easier when you: 1. Know how to clearly convey what you offer & can get to the point quickly to capture your audience.

2. Know exactly who you serve & what they want.

3. Know what makes you and your services unique. BUY TICKETS NOW

Hosted by Tracy Robin of Holistic Women Entrepreneurs & Sam Popp of Teach & Learn Networking, your will leave with fresh inspiration & a new community to support you in your entrepreneurial journey AND the confidence to write and speak clearly about what you have to offer so you attract more clients ready to say YES to working with you. BRING A NOTEBOOK & PEN.

BUY TICKETS NOW

Who can attend?

Women Entrepreneurs and women starting or transitioning into their own biz - who are passionate about personal & professional development, and who want connect and be in community with other dynamic women in business.

What should I bring?

Bring A Notebook, Pen, Business cards, a friend if you'd like, & an open mind. A friendly reminder that on-street parking is available on Anderson & the side streets. Some spots are metered, some are not. If you park at a metered spot, be sure to feed it. 50 cents gives you 2 hours. :)

How much does it cost?

$5 online (plus service fees) or $10 at the door. Enjoy a glass of wine and chocolates from our sponsors PLUS surprise giveaways. RSVP and we'll see you there!

BUY TICKETS NOW


Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information.

Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 1-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is free with a $10 suggested donation.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 1pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 1pm and will run until 3:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING. Defenders with 2 feet inside own forbidden zone equals a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Attackers inside opponent's forbidden zone equals loss of posession. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Re-enbolso de su pago se permitirá solo si se cancela 24 horas antes del evento (Sabado 1pm) AL MAS TARDAR.

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 1pm y jugamos hasta las 3:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR.  Defensa con 2 pies en Zona proibida propia equivale a penal sin portero desde cualquier esquina opuesta. Atacante ingresando a zona proibida rival equivale a perdida de posesion.

Se jugaran partidos de 8 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

results.description:
You’re invited to a private screening of “The Celiac Project”!

Join the NYC Celiac Disease Meetup Group for a private screening of

“The Celiac Project” documentary hosted by Pie By the Pound!


Sunday March 20th 1:00-3:00pm

Pie By the Pound

124 4th Avenue between 12th and 13th St


$25 per person

Includes all-you-can-eat pizza, one drink & dessert!

Meet other gluten free folk, watch the documentary, and join the discussion!


Purchase tickets here:

BUY TICKETS

About the Film:

The Celiac Project is a dynamic, first-of-its-kind documentary about life before and after the diagnosis of Celiac Disease.  Filmmaker, Michael Frolichstein, struggled with a series of “mystery ailments” before finally being diagnosed with Celiac disease at age 40.  His journey to meet others who had suffered, as well as get answers from experts, led him to uncover more mysteries within his own family.  His documentary explores what we can do individually and as a society to advance the conversation and raise awareness about the disease.

Want your very own copy of the DVD?

Members of the NYC Celiac Disease Meetup Group receive $5 off their DVD purchase with code "celiac5".

Visit www.celiacproject.com for more info and to purchase.


About Pie By The Pound:

Pie is a 14 year old, grab-and-go local artisanal pizza hangout specializing in Gluten Free (pizza, truffle grilled sandwiches, cider, beer, and desserts). Pie By the Pound serves both gluten free and regular pizza, taking every precaution to reduce the risk of cross contamination.

Note: RSVPing on the Meetup site does not guarantee you a spot. You must pay for the event in advance through the link above. This is a non-refundable event. No cancellations or refunds. 

*Disclaimer: the NYC Celiac Disease Meetup Group and its event organizers cannot be held responsible for any negative reaction that you may experience from food/drink at an event. It is always up to the individual attendees to make decisions regarding where and what they eat. This is not your home kitchen, so remember it is eat at your own risk.
results.name: "The Celiac Project" Documentary Screening at Pie By The Pound

results.description:
Learn how to wire wrap crystals to create spiritually inspired one-of-a-kind jewelry at our Crystal Wire Wrapping Workshop!


In this workshop you will learn two basic wire wrapping techniques that will allow you to create customized jewelry for your needs. During the workshop, we will also discuss on how to cleanse and program your stones for your use.

Martha Vallejo the owner of Crystal Path Creations has made crystal wire jewelry for Namaste Book and Gift shop as well as OM Namaste, where she currently works. Martha also teaches metaphysical classes and intuitive wire jewelry workshops. https://www.etsy.com/shop/CrystalPathCreations


https://www.facebook.com/crystalpathcreations

Martha Vallejo will be teaching the workshop on crystal wrapping and renowned psychic and healer, Laura Schwalm will be providing mini-readings for clients who are interested! During these readings, clients can ask questions regarding their health, finances, romance and spirituality. The rate of the mini-readings will be $30.00 for 15 minutes.

During the workshop, tools and materials will be supplied, but feel free to bring along your own crystals to work with. Everyone will leave with at least two ready-to-wear healing crystal necklaces by the conclusion of the workshop.


If you are interested in just taking the crystal wire workshop the price is $30.00. Packages include: Crystal Wire Wrapping Workshop and one mini-reading for $50.00, or Two readings and the workshop for $60.00.


Wine, cheese and light refreshments will be served! Please come on time. Cash and credit cards are accepted. If you have any other inquiries about the workshop or are going to be late please text at[masked]

Love and light,

Laura Schwalm

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

It's Chris Lima here. I will be hosting a HealthRHYTHMS Session for you on Sunday, March 20th, 2016. HealthRHYTHMS is a research-based life enhancement tool and program. It is a group drumming protocol that has demonstrated positive results in one's overall well being.   This Group Empowerment Drumming Program promotes:

1.) Communication
2.) Stress Reduction
3.) Clarity
4.) Personal Expression
5.) Creativity and Bonding Enhancement

I am your Remo HealthRhythms Facilitator for this event, and would like you to please join me. When we can express what's truly on our minds through meditative and music related exercises, we can then begin to live full and healthy lives. Let's take that step together with the support of everyone joining us for this session.  Take the time to learn more about yourself and others. That's what it's about :) 

Price for this Meetup is: $15.00.  Please Bring:

1.) A drum, and any extras (if you have)
2.) Any small instruments. (if you have)                                                 If you do not have a drum or any small instruments I will be providing some for this event....Not to worry! :) 

Plenty of time too, we have the space for 2 Hours, and can probably get a nice few Jams in for the end.  I'm really looking forward to this, and I hope you can all make it out...Hope to see you there! :)

-Chris Lima

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society & Mark Gerrard presents:

"Mark G. Farewell Shoot #2 w/Stacy Winters, Kelly Larsen & Louise Ann - Mar. 20th"

With the success of our last farewell shoot for Mark Gerrard, we were able to setup one more shoot from his list of favorite models. As most may or may not know, Mark will be leaving New Jersey for Seattle on the 26th, so once again we decided to open up this shoot to the public to enjoy on final shoot with new and old friends alike. This time around we have newcomers to the group, Stacy Winters and Kelly Larsen. We welcome them to the group and we're happy to have them be a part of the lineup. We also have returning beauty, Louise Ann who made a memorable impression on us all last time and looking forward to having her back for another amazing shoot.

About the Shoot: 

This shoot will follow a free form style much like the group's usual Model Spotlight format. 3 looks from each model. (4th look pending time) Every shooter will have a certain amount of time with the model for each look so they can direct and have a mini one on one type of shooting experience. Weather permitting, we'll get to shoot outdoors in groups with the free form style and take advantage of the outdoor setting. Indoors, we'll have setups ready for the models to shoot in. (Strobe and LED lighting.)

What to bring:

With this shoot, feel free to bring your speed lights with your preferred modifiers, if you wish. There will be lighting setup at certain stations for the three models but if you are opting to shoot, lets say outdoors or a location that doesn't have lighting during your time to shoot then your speed light will be more convenient for portability.

RSVP:

Deposit is required to secure a spot and also to have the financials in order for the models. So, only sign up if you know you will attend. Deposits are due at the time of signup.

Total Cost: $100

Deposit: $30 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $70, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Models: 

Stacy Winters: Facebook (lingerie)

(Photos provided by model and model's social media page for promotional purposes only. Photo Credits: NikitaBoyd)

Louise Ann: Instagram (lingerie, implied)

(Photo Credit: Tim Evans)

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

Kelly Larsen: Facebook (lingerie, implied, nude)

(Photos provided by model and model's social media page for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please Meetup message me or email me at [masked]
results.name: Mark G. Farewell Shoot #2 w/Stacy Winters, Kelly Larsen & Louise Ann - Mar. 20th

results.description:
Join us on Sunday, March 20th for 2 hrs of community, networking, learning & a lively discussion over yummy vegan cookies. We'll be learning about essential marketing basics & strategies that work for holistic women in business. 

Knowing how to write & talk about what you do is surprisingly challenging for entrepreneurs, especially for holistic women who offer services that help so many different areas of life & business. Many of us work with energy or talk about health & wellness for the body, mind & spirit - which can either sound a little woo-woo to the masses or just sounds like what everyone else is offering. Yikes! 

How then, do you stand out and let them know that what you have to offer is unique? And how do you do that in a way that is fast, clear, concise & not boring. 

If you have trouble explaining what you do & what they get - how can you expect them to invest in your services?

Marketing your services becomes so much easier when you: 

1. Know how to clearly convey what you offer & can get to the point quickly to capture your audience.

2. Know exactly who you serve & what they want.

3. Know what makes you and your services unique. 

Hosted by Tracy Robin of Holistic Women Entrepreneurs your will leave with fresh inspiration & the confidence to write and speak clearly about what you have to offer so you attract more clients ready to say YES to working with you. BRING A NOTEBOOK & PEN.

Who can attend?

Women Entrepreneurs and women starting or transitioning into their own biz - who are passionate about personal & professional development, and who want connect and be in community with other dynamic women in business.

What should I bring?

Bring A Notebook, Pen, Business cards, a friend if you'd like, & an open mind. 

How much does it cost?

$5 online (plus service fees) or $10 at the door. 

OUR SPONSOR

Dawn Catherine Pascale is the owner of Om Sweet Home, a local Hoboken business specializing in all things SWEET, VEGAN & GLUTEN FREE!!! All ingredients are organic & of the highest quality!

Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information. 


Your Host:


Tracy Robin

Tracy Robin (@TracyRobinWR) is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. She is also the founder of The YogaLifeStyle with Tracy & Holistic Women Entrepreneurs Meetup. She is passionate about supporting women in their personal & professional development and creates sacred space & programming that builds community, provides education & support for success in all areas of your life. An entrepreneur & business owner since 2000, she coaches clients globally and travels nationally & internationally leading classes, workshops & retreats. Be sure to connect with Tracy on Facebook.


SPACE PARTNER 

Shine Yoga Center (@shineyogacenter) is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://shineyogacenter.com/main

results.description:
Come & see the adorable move with Sally Fields, "Hello, My Name is Doris" and after we'll get a bite to eat at a casual, near by restaurant.

89%·Rotten Tomatoes

When Doris Miller meets John Fremont, her company's hip new art director, sparks fly-at least for Doris. In the cluttered house she shared with her late mother, Doris mines the Internet for information on her one-and-only, guided by the 13-year-old granddaughter of her best pal Roz. When Doris begins showing up at John's regular haunts, she wins over his Williamsburg friends. Her new life brings Doris a thrilling perspective, but also creates a rift between her and her longtime friends and family, who believe she's making a f...more----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 NYTIMES

Review: ‘Hello, My Name Is Doris,’ About an Older Woman’s Love for a Much Younger ManHello, My Name Is Doris

By MANOHLA DARGISMARCH 10, 2016

The first time that the heroine in the disarming comedy “Hello, My Name Is Doris” sees the kid, they’re in a crowded office elevator. He’s not a child at all, but somewhere in his mid-30s, which can seem light-years away for a woman who has been of a certain age for decades. So when he jostles Doris (Sally Field), she braces for the usual morning-elevator scrum. Instead, he straightens her lopsided eyeglasses. With this one small, human kindness he does something that astonishes Doris, something that doesn’t often happen to the world’s invisible women: He sees her.

Not that Doris, who’s in her 60s, tries to be invisible, exactly. From her cat-eye glasses to the headscarves that make her look hastily regifted, she seems like someone yearning to be seen. But wrinkles have a way of making women disappear one crease at a time, and Doris, who’s in mourning when the movie opens, has done her part to vanish. When this kid — he turns out to be a new co-worker, John (Max Greenfield, an effortless charmer) — notices Doris, it changes everything. Doris is more than just surprised by his attention, she is also transformed. He makes her visible, most importantly to herself, a revelation that turns Doris into a woman who desires and is desired in turn. It’s a ferocious awakening.

It’s also a fairly slow, gaudy bloom. Like his heroine, the director Michael Showalter eagerly oversells the goods. Right off, he throws in a lot that’s hard on the eyes and ears. There’s Doris’s dowager-dumpster wardrobe and topsy-turvy Staten Island house, along with her mutterings and facial contortions, which seem one tic away from a medical diagnosis. As he puts these messy parts into play, I kept thinking no, no, no, no. It’s all much too much (those shoes, that hair!) and together they announce that you’re in for an ingratiatingly cutesy slog about a lovable kook — except that the movie and Doris aren’t easy to love, which is partly why they work.

Kindly pay the $3.00 event fee to Paypal before you RSVP -this is to maintain the monthly Meet Up Fee, the printing costs,  & group costs, Thank you. If you don't have Paypal, just scroll down to the prompt and pay with a credit or debit card.  Much appreciated.

The movie starts big and broad at the funeral for Doris’s mother, where everyone is shedding stage tears. Seated pointedly alone, Doris looks ashen enough that she wouldn’t be out of place next to Mom in the open coffin. The whole thing is as dire as the priest’s eulogy, but a few beats later, when Doris’s brother, Todd (the great character actor Stephen Root), speaks to her with unforced feeling, the movie shifts into something more complex. Mr. Showalter continues to play with comic tone and mood — he folds in some slapstick, enables the mugging and stages several cringing fantasy sequences that encourage you to laugh at Doris. It feels cruel, specifically because she isn’t an ordinary American movie protagonist: She’s an older, frumpy, lower-middle-class woman who works in a cubicle.

Indirection can be a beautiful tool in comedy and so it is in “Hello, My Name Is Doris,” which uses this funny, outwardly ridiculous character to tell a simple story about a love that rarely speaks its name, including in movies: that of an older woman for a much younger man. These kinds of screen stories have always been few and far between, and it’s instructive, given the prevailing cultural horror of aging, that some of the more memorable ones turn on her-or-his pathology, whether it’s the deranged actress in “Sunset Boulevard” or the traumatized boy-man in the cult film “Harold and Maude.” Doris has issues, mostly grief and social isolation, which Ms. Field makes movingly real with a performance that reveals its truth incrementally.
